details:
Infogroup is looking for top talent to join our fast-paced and innovative team. We are seeking a Sr. Database Developer to join our Burlington, MA office. This position is responsible for the design, development, operation and analysis of the Company's database marketing systems.

Essential Job Functions:
1. Develop, code, update, and maintain database processes.

2. Modify, test, and support applications for the purpose of upgrading or enhancing database software.

3. Design and develop PL/SQL processes to perform complex ETL processes.

4. Develop Unix and Perl scripts for data auditing and automation.

5. Construct and design documents and documentation to aid in maintenance and code reuse in accordance with team processes and standards.

6. Develop strong working relationships with managers and analysts.

7. Participate in code reviews in accordance to standards.

8. Analyze data needs and independently develop logical and physical data models.

9. Coordinate the implementation of database application components.


10. Interact with key partners and internal users regarding timelines, technical issues, and infrastructure integration.
11. Understand and work with data in with varying degrees of complexity and scale.

12. Coordinate and participate in application testing and quality inspections.

Knowledge, Skill, and Abilities:
1. Knowledge of relational database, and programming processing concepts.

2. Knowledge of software development lifecycles and methodologies.

3. Possesses advanced software development and scripting skills for use in automation and interfacing with databases.

4. Knowledge of ETL tools.

5. Knowledge of Oracle/MS SQL database skills (SQL, PL/SQL, TSQL).

6. Knowledge of MySQL, SQL Server and SQL tuning.

7. Knowledge of developing procedures, packages and functions in DW environment.

8. Knowledge of Unix and Linux.

9. Knowledge of Service Oriented Architecture (SOA).

10. Ability to multi-task, to work under pressure, and think analytically.

11. Ability to work with minimal supervision and meet deadlines.

12. Ability to write technical specifications and documents.

13. Ability to communicate with individuals at all levels in the company and with various business contacts outside of the company in an articulate, professional manner.

14. Knowledge of CRM, MDM and Business Intelligence is a plus.


Education, Experience, and Certification:
1. Bachelor's degree or equivalent computer related field or equivalent is required.

2. 5+ years of related experience is required.

3. Experience using TalenD or Ab Initio is a plus.

title: Database Developer

details:
Position Summary:
As a member of the Enterprise Applications team, the Database Administrator (DBA)/Developer will work with the existing database administrator, the Application Development team, and business stakeholders to plan, design, and deliver software solutions for the business.
The DBA must be familiar with database design concepts, methods for creating highly available environments, industry standards for security and integrity, options for integrating onsite and hosted data sources, tools for monitoring and tuning database instances, and programming techniques for writing efficient queries.  In addition, the DBA must be able to effectively establish and document requirements, track and report on projects, publish technical documentation of solutions, and research and understand best practices and regulatory obligations.
The right candidate will ideally have past hands-on experience administering MS SQL databases running in a public cloud environment such as AWS or MS Azure.


 Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Assess the health of databases,  articulate issues, and formulate resolutions to improve health and performance
Design, build, analyze, tune, back up, and support databases
Understand and able to troubleshoot and maintain database servers
Take proactive measures to monitor, trend, and tune SQL databases, such as running maintenance jobs (backups, DBCCs, applying indexes/re-indexing, etc.), to meet or exceed baseline stability and performance SLAs
Develop and maintain SQL stored procedures, views, functions, ETL programs, and ad-hoc queries to support business needs
Develop, schedule, and monitor SSIS packages
Integrate data from various back-end databases and data sources

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.  The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and abilities required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this job.


Educations and/or Experience:


Bachelor’s Degree in information technology or a related field or equivalent work experience
3+ years’ experience administering and maintaining replicated Microsoft SQL Server databases in a distributed production environment
1+ years of Azure administration will be a huge plus.

Development experience with SSRS, SSIS, and automating SQL Server deployment and configuration through PowerShell, Chef, etc.
Experience with PowerShell scripting
Proficiency with query optimization, SQL development, parameterized queries, and T-SQL for developing complex stored procedures, triggers, etc.

Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos.  Ability to write simple correspondence.  Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization.

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.

To perform this job successfully, an individual should be proficient in SQL, T-SQL.  Understanding and working knowledge of HTML, CSS, ASP and .Net required.

Overview
Vencore is a proven provider of information solutions, engineering and analytics for the U.S. Government. With more than 40 years of experience working in the defense, civilian and intelligence communities, Vencore designs, develops and delivers high impact, mission-critical services and solutions to overcome its customers most complex problems. Headquartered in Chantilly, Virginia, Vencore employs 3,800 engineers, analysts, IT specialists and other professionals who strive to be the best at everything they do. Vencore is an AA/EEO Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories

Responsibilities

Responsibilities: 
Designs, creates, and maintains Oracle databases in a client/server and web environment for mission critical production applications.
Conducts quality control and auditing of databases in a client/server and web environment to ensure accurate and appropriate use of data.
Troubleshoots production problems related to software applications and database transactions in application code as well as in stored procedures.
Advises users on access to various client/server and web databases.
Designs, implements, and maintains complex databases with respect to access methods, access time, device allocation, validation checks, organization, protection and security, documentation, and statistical methods.
Responsible for building and deploying database updates to real-time production, working with several environments and QA process.
Applies knowledge and experience with database technologies, development methodologies, and front-end/back-end programming languages (e.g., SQL).

Designs, develops and normalizes database schemas.

Analyzes user needs, develops user stories and decomposes to database solutions.

Reviews and optimizes PL/SQL statements.
Evaluates database design tradeoffs, impacts on user expectations and performance levels.Performs as part of an agile team, utilizing Kanban and Scrum best practices. Collaborates frequently with other team members. Mentors other DBAs across the agile teams. Shares best practices with all DBAs.

Required


5+ years of relevant experience, with a Bachelor's in Computer Science, Engineering or other Technical degree preferred

Install an Oracle database, set up infrastructure

title: Database Developer

details:
Summary: The Database Administrator will be responsible for the implementation, configuration, maintenance, and performance of critical database systems, to ensure the availability and consistent performance of our corporate applications. This is a “hands-on” position requiring solid technical skills, as well as excellent interpersonal and communication skills. The successful candidate will be responsible for the development and sustainment of the database server farm, ensuring its operational readiness (security, health and performance), executing data loads, and performing data modeling in support of multiple development teams. The server farm supports a service provider application suite of program management tools.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  
 
1.      Install, administer, manage and maintenance SQL Server databases through multiple product lifecycle (Test, Dev, Staging and Production) environments, from development to mission-critical production systems.
2.      Configure and maintain database servers and processes, including monitoring of system health and performance, to ensure high levels of performance, availability, and security.
3.      Apply data modeling techniques to ensure development and implementation support efforts meet integration and performance expectations
4.      Assist developers with complex query tuning and schema refinement.
5.      Share domain and technical expertise, providing technical mentorship and cross-training to other peers and team members.
6.      Define technical requirements and data architecture for the underlying data warehouse including developing and optimizing ETL processes
7.      Refine and automate regular processes, track issues, and document changes as well as documenting major changes to the database environment. 
8.      Independently analyze, solve, and correct issues in real time, providing problem resolution end-to-end.
9.      Has experience working with large Tables
10.  Create Users and assign permissions based on the level of database access the user would need.
11.  Create Linked Servers to SQL Servers and other databases such as Oracle, Access, Mongo, MySQL etc. 
12.  Design database backup and restoration strategy and monitor those backups are being performed

details:

This position is a Microsoft SQL Server DBA role responsible for operational and developmental support services to the organization.  Responsibilities include monitoring, maintaining, and improving the database architecture and ensuring the 24/7 availability of these systems.

Install and configure new SQL Servers/SSRS/SSIS/SSAS application to specified guidelines or 3rd party application requirements
Administer all SQL Server environments (i.e. Development, Test, Production)
Maintain, support, and augment transactional replication
Install and test upgrades and patches on existing SQL Servers
Perform database migrations
Troubleshoot SQL Server performance issues
Maintain daily database maintenance tasks
Creation of a database backup and restore QA process
Work with internal development teams and 3rd Party vendors for application deployments
Alerts/Notification management and resolution
Provide on call 24x7 support of database systems

Production experience implementing and managing transactional replication.
Understanding of database backup, recovery processes.
Strong ability to troubleshoot and resolve performance issues in production environments.
Ability to multitask and adjust easily to changing priorities or projects.
Possess excellent analytical and problem solving skills.
Ability to work extended hours, including weekends, holidays and participate in on-call rotation.
Demonstrates strong oral / written communication and listening skills.
Demonstrates close attention to details and accuracy.

details:
Position Summary : This position will focus on database management, donor data reporting and analysis of donor services. The incumbent in this position will be working with the Agency  Development department at the Miami, 33125 location.  Must be detail oriented and possess strong witting and grammatical skills. This is a part time position ($12.00 per hour) with up to 25 hours a week that requires flexible schedule. 
Responsibilities:
Database Management:


Manage ESSF e-Tapestry database and ensure it supports the transactional information needs of ESSF.


Monitor general usage guidelines and best practices, including, but not limited to data hygiene, donor acknowledgements, tax receipts, training materials, reporting, database security, and maintenance.


Create mailing lists, donor lists, canned reports, customized reports, etc. as requested by colleagues.


Document procedures, updating and revising as necessary.


Serve as a resource for advice or information related to the ESSF donor database.


Donor Services and Stewardship:


Process, track, report and acknowledge all gifts in an accurate and timely fashion.


Respond to any and all donor requests via website donation line, email or postal mail.


Manage accurate recording of new and existing pledges and maintain process for issuing pledge reminders and recurring gift renewals; liaise with finance staff as appropriate.


Monitor matching gifts, and President’s Council Stewardship


Work with development team members on donor stewardship reports


Data Liaison:


Serve as the day to day donor data manager.


Work with the VP of Development to reconcile monthly financials.


Troubleshoot problems, improve overall processes, ensure deadlines can be met even during periods of heavy gift volume.


Ensure database security.


Monitor and submit invoicing.


Data Analytics and Reporting:


Report on financial information, donor trends and any other demographics and fundraising, and analysis points.


Analyze data in e-Tapestry database, measure data, and participate in marketing plans that require data input.


Special Events


Assist the Director of Special Events & Marketing with meeting preparations, type/edit agenda, correspondence/contacting members, and meeting minutes.


Assist with soliciting and securing in-kind donations for event auctions and also to assist obtaining in-kind services for events.


Coordinate all donor mailings including exporting lists, mail merge, printing, and mailing.


Other Responsibilities :


Ensure confidentiality with all information as well as the security and safety of all documents/checks.


Ensure the safety of all staff, volunteers, visitors and individuals receiving services at Easter Seals.


Work a flexible schedule as required.


Other duties as assigned.


,


Qualifications and Skills Requirements:



College degree or equivalent work experience


Two to five years relevant work experience in database management in a nonprofit, marketing or fundraising environment. Ability to work a flexible schedule, including evening and weekend events.


Proficiency with donor data software is essential.


Experience with e-tapestry is preferred.


Highly organized and well versed in office procedures and systems.


Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of relevant gift reporting and accounting requirements to ensure compliance with IRS and FASB regulations and industry standards. Basic knowledge of donor services, tax receipt and acknowledgement production and process.

details:
Oracle Database Administrator
Lansing, MI
1+ year contract
 
In person only
 
USC/GC only
 
 Responsible for query/data analysis, database administration, automated task scheduling, and reporting/document management services. Involved in maintenance, enhancement, designing of data dictionaries, physical & logical database models, performance tuning
 
Years of Experience:
4-7 years of experience.

Job Description:
Has knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field. Relies on instructions and pre-established guidelines to perform the functions of the job. Primary job functions do not typically require exercising independent judgment.
 
·         Responsible for data analysis and database management. Involved in maintenance, enhancement, designing of data dictionaries, physical and logical database models, and performance tuning. Knowledge of the utilities and production tools used for data storage management to support the Application Team. Coordinates physical changes to computer databases; codes, tests, and implements physical database, applying knowledge of data base management system. Designs logical and physical databases reviews description of changes to database design to understand how changes to be made affect physical data base (how data is stored in terms of physical characteristics, such as location, amount of space, and access method).
·         Establishes physical database parameters. Uses structured query language (SQL) to define database objects using database definition language (DDL) and control access to database objects using data control language (DCL).  Language descriptions and specifies identifiers of database to database management system or directs others in coding database descriptions. Calculates optimum values for database parameters, such as amount of computer memory to be used by database, following manuals and using calculator. Specifies user access level for each segment of one or more data items, such as insert, replace, retrieve, or delete data. Specifies which users can access data bases and what data can be accessed by user. Tests and corrects errors, and refines changes to database.
·         Enters SQL to create production data base. Uses database utility programs and 3rd party utilities to monitor database performance, such as distribution of records and amount of available memory. Directs programmers and analysts to make changes to data base management system. Reviews and corrects programs. Answers user questions. Confers with coworkers to determine impact of data base changes on other systems and staff cost for making changes to data base. Modifies data base programs to increase processing performance, referred to as performance tuning. Workers typically specialize in one or more types of data base management systems. Providing assistance in the planning, development, maintenance, and monitoring of integrated database systems, and ensuring that the conceptual and design phases of new applications are consistent with the structural parameters within the database environment.
·         Evaluates users' requests for new data elements and systems, incorporates them into the existing shared data environment, and provides technical assistance. Coordinates the use of data to ensure data integrity and control redundancy, loads databases, and reorganizes as needed. Performs data modeling and prototyping. Performs logical and physical data modeling, designs relational database models, and creates physical data models from logical data models. Performs security recovery procedures. Determines and implements database search strategies and storage requirements. Maintains data dictionary ensuring uniformity of definitions and sets standards for use of data dictionary. Monitors database performance and recommends efficiency improvements. Creates test database environment for applications section, including the creation of necessary libraries and procedures.
·         Executes the procedures necessary to save, retrieve, and recover databases from hardware and software failures within established procedures. Assists with determining, implementing, and enhancing standards on database security and with monitoring agency disaster recovery procedures and systems. Assists with the installation of database software and with analyzing, designing, and implementing databases. Assists in benchmarking and threshold testing of databases and with establishing and controlling necessary database security. Assists in the selection of database management software. Experience in computer systems analysis or computer programming work.
·         Knowledge of the principles, practices, and techniques of computer programming and systems design; of computer operations, systems, and procedures; of project control and cost estimating techniques; of computer programming languages; of data processing flowcharting techniques; of database structures and theories; and of current database technologies.
 
Best Regards,
 
Satish Kumar Sinha
Metahorizon Inc.

lrving, Texas 75038

details: JOB SUMMARY A Database Administrator, Sr, works under limited supervision to design and maintain databases that control the operation of the Bank's applications systems. Evaluates, designs and/or modifies multiple and more complex existing or proposed systems to structure, utilize and/or access databases. As assigned, may develop, code, test, debug and/or maintain databases including Oracle, SQL Server, Sybase and DB2.  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS Manages and maintains all production, non-production and DR databases. Analyzes and supports database systems that tend to be of broader size and scope and of significant impact within a business context. Implements and/or integrates databases and/or client requirements related to databases requirements. Responsible for standards and design of physical data storage, maintenance, access and security administration. Performs backup and recovery on Database Management Systems, configures database parameters, and prototype designs against logical data models, defines data repository requirements, data dictionaries and warehousing requirements. Optimizes database access and allocates/re-allocates database resources for optimum configuration, database performance and cost. Performs work that is highly complex and varied in nature. Develops integrated solutions to resolve highly complex technical and business issues. Defines and discerns key aspects of a problem and develops an integrated solution within a broad technical and business context of significant impact. Provides guidance/training to more junior staff. Requires technical and business knowledge in multiple disciplines/processes. Consults with and advises users on access to various databases. Works directly with users to resolve data conflicts and inappropriate data usage. May generate scripts for administrative functions, devise sample test data, and run associated tests. Directs the maintenance and use of the corporate data dictionary. Adheres to polices, procedures and standards. Recommends changes in procedures. Ensures the accurate and timely communication of the status of assignment, job responsibilities, and the resolution of problems to the appropriate parties. Creates estimates and determines resource requirements for assignments and tracks progress against major milestones. Prepares status, and special analysis reports using project management methodologies. Participates in customer/user meetings as required. Maintains industry knowledge and participates in technical training as recommended or required by Manager. Performs special projects and additional duties and responsibilities as required. Where applicable and when performing the responsibilities of the job, employees are accountable to maintain Sarbanes-Oxley compliance and adhere to internal control policies and procedures.  EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE Bachelor's degree in information technology or technical institute degree/certificate or equivalent application development experience. Certification in (or near completion of) Database Management Systems (DBMS) preferred. Minimum of five years of experience as a Database Administrator. Minimum of ten (10) years of IT work experience including managing team(s) responsible for SQL & Oracle database administration and support. Experience with web-enabled enterprise applications, protocols and standards. Experience deploying and supporting databases in a virtual environment. Extensive experience with SQL and Oracle vulnerability, hardening and patch management, including risk remediation. Experience supporting agile project initiatives. Experience with SQL programming such as T-SQL, including SQL queries, stored procedures & views. Application cluster experience required. Demonstrated experience in database administration, Microsoft SQL & Oracle. SQL Server 2008 R2 thru SQL 2016 and Oracle 12C. Proven experience in IT infrastructure planning and development.  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES Expert knowledge of SQL & Oracle databases and the ability to obtain Microsoft SQL certifications. Comprehensive knowledge of, and the ability to apply some advanced concepts, practices and procedures used in designing and managing a database environment. Strong analytical and organizational skills. Excellent project management skills. Strong verbal and written communication skills, good negotiation skills. Detail oriented. Self-starter with positive initiative. Exercises sound judgment. Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and meet established deadlines. Ability to work well with others, as well as independently. Access to reliable transportation with the ability to work *on-call* and respond to system support issues. Ability to train, delegate and review the work of lower level employees. Ability to prioritize and organize work assignments for a work group. Ability to maintain a professional composure with customers in difficult situations. Ability to maintain confidentiality with regard to customer information and employee records. Ability to travel 10% - 25% of the time.  ABOUT NEW YORK COMMUNITY BANCORP, INC. New York Community Bancorp, Inc. (NYSE: NYCB) is one of the 25 largest bank holding companies in the nation, with assets of $48.3 billion and a market cap of $6.4 billion at June 30, 2017. With deposits of $28.9 billion and 255 branches in Metro New York, New Jersey, Florida, Arizona, and Ohio, NYCB also rank among the largest depositories in the United States. NYCB operates through two banks with eight local divisions - New York Community Bank a savings bank with 225 branches throughout our five-state franchise; and New York Commercial Bank which has 30 branches. With a longstanding reputation for strength, stability and service, NYCB is proud to be committed to the communities it serves. To learn more about the NYCB Family of Banks visit us at www.mynycb.com  BRANCH OUT and help recruit top talent for NYCB through the employee referral program. All NYCB employees are encouraged to submit referrals. Locate top talent right in the community where you live, work and play. Amazing individuals are all around be sure to let them know how they can become a part of the NYCB family.  NYCB is an equal opportunity employer that prohibits discrimination in hiring or terms and conditions of employment on the basis of race, color, age, sex, national origin, ethnicity, religion, marital status, disability, military status, veteran status, domestic violence victim status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other classification protected by the federal, state, and local laws and ordinances.   This policy is applicable to all terms and conditions of employment including, but not limited to: recruitment and selection, promotion and demotion, transfer, training and development, compensation, benefits, leaves of absence and termination. When necessary, NYCB will reasonably accommodate employees and applicants with disabilities or with religious requirements necessitating accommodation.   In addition, NYCB complies with all applicable laws which govern nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which NYCB does business.

title: Database Developer

details:
We are conducting a Search for our client, who is an A Rated Property & Casualty Insurance carrier for a Database Administrator. This position installs, monitors, maintains, and performance tunes production databases while ensuring high levels of data availability. This position will provide maintenance and support of all SQL Server Database Environments. The incumbent is also responsible for developing, implementing, and overseeing database policies and procedures to ensure the integrity and availability of databases and their accompanying software.

Essential Functions:


Strategy & Planning

Assess and develop long-term strategic goals for production databases in conjunction with data owners and department managers.
Design and implement redundant systems, policies, and procedures for disaster recovery and data archiving to ensure effective protection and integrity of data assets.
Ability to evaluate risks and opportunities in virtualization and use of Cloud resources





Acquisition & Deployment

Conduct research and make recommendations on database products, services, protocols, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts.





Operational Management

Install and configure relevant network components to ensure database access as well as database consistency and integrity.
Respond to and resolve database access and performance issues.
Monitor database system details within the database, including stored procedures and execution time, and implement efficiency improvements.
Monitor, optimize, and allocate physical data storage for database systems.
Plan and coordinate data migrations between systems.
Develop, implement, and maintain change control and testing processes for modifications to databases.
Perform database transaction and security audits.
Establish appropriate end-user database access control levels.
Develop routines for end users to facilitate best practices database use.
Manage and/or provide guidance to junior members of the team.
Complete SQL Server installs, test, maintain, and document database management systems, utility programs, monitoring tools
Add/Delete tables, build indexes, etc
Develop scripts for tasks such as system monitoring and cleanup
Coordinate install times/testing/environment roll out for object migration across Dev, QA, and Prod environments
Examine hardware resources such as size of machine and DASD allocations to the databases to ensure space, system allocations, and performance is maintained.
Collaborate with auditors to provide requested documentation as needed
Operate as a guardian of company data and protect/encrypt/redact PII data.




Qualifications/Basic Job Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in the field of computer science and 5 years equivalent work experience
3 years SQL Server Database environments/experience
Strong understanding of database structures, theories, principles, and practices
Working technical experience with designing, building, installing, configuring, and supporting database servers, including SQL Server 2008 and 2014
Working knowledge of SQL Server Management Studio, SQL Server Profiler, SQL
Server Agent, Database Engine Tuning Advisor, BCP and Bulk Load
Working knowledge of Windows Server 2012 configuration and management, specifically as it relates to MS SQL Server installations
Hands-on database tuning and troubleshooting experience
Experience with data processing flowcharting techniques
Project management experience
Strong understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives
Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws
Good written and oral communication skills
Strong technical documentation skills
Good interpersonal skills
Ability to conduct research into database issues, standards, and products as required
Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language
Highly self-motivated and directed
Keen attention to detail
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
Strong customer service orientation
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment


see job description
title: Database Developer

details:
SQL DBA Responsibilities



Installation, Administration and Maintenance of
SQL Server Instances and its tools and any other tools that access the SQL
databases. 


Setup Test, Dev, Staging and Production
Environments. 


Create Users and assign permissions based on the
level of database access the user would need. (Security)


Create Linked Servers to SQL Servers and other
databases such as Oracle, Access, Informix etc. 


Design database Backup and Restoration Strategy.



Once created the database Backups, monitor those
backups are being performed regularly. 


From time to time recover the databases to a
specific point of time, as per the requests.


Setup High-Availability as part Disaster
Recovery Strategy for the Databases. 


Troubleshoot various problems that arise in a
day-to-day work and fix the issues. 


Monitoring and Performance Tuning; Physical
Server Level, Database level (Database settings and options) and query tuning. 


Documenting major changes to the SQL Servers. 


Apply Service Packs. 


Maintain STIG Compliance


Perform monthly security audits on all logins
and users connecting to SQL Server.


 

Oracle DBA Responsibilities



Installation, Administration and Maintenance of Oracle instances and its tools and any other tools that access the Oracle databases. 


 


Creates and maintains all databases required for development, testing, 


education and production usage.
 


Performs the capacity planning required to create and maintain the 


databases. 
 


Performs ongoing tuning of the database instances.


 


Plans and implements backup and recovery of the Oracle database.


 


Controls migrations of programs, database changes, reference data changes 


and menu changes through the development life cycle.
 


Implements and enforces security for all of the Oracle Databases. 


 


Performs database re-organizations as required to assist performance and 


ensure maximum uptime of the database.
 


Puts standards in place to ensure that all application design and code is 


produced with proper integrity, security and performance. The DBA will perform
reviews on the design and code frequently to ensure the site standards are 
being adhered to.
 


Evaluates releases of Oracle and its tools, and third party products to 


ensure that the site is running the products that are most appropriate. 
Planning is also performed by the DBA, along with the application developers 
and System administrators, to ensure that any new product usage or release 
upgrade takes place with minimal impact.
 


Provides technical support to application development teams. This is 


usually in the form of a help desk. The DBA is usually the point of contact 
with the Oracle Corporation. 
 


Enforces and maintains database constraints to ensure integrity of the 


database.
 


Administers all database objects, including tables, clusters, indexes, 


views, sequences, packages and procedures. 
 


Assists with impact analysis of any changes made to the database objects.


 


Troubleshoots with  problems regarding the databases, applications and 


development tools.
 


Create new database users as required.


 


Manage sharing of resources amongst applications.


 


The DBA has ultimate responsibility for the physical database design. 


 


Applies all required patches


 


Documenting changes to the environment.


 


Perform monthly security audits on all logins
and users connecting to Oracle Servers.




Maintain STIG Compliance



The DBA should posses the following skills 
(1) A good knowledge of the operating system(s) (
2) A good knowledge of physical database design 
(3) Ability to monitor database and operating system performance and make the necessary adjustments. 
(4) Be able to provide a strategic database direction for the organization. 
(5) Excellent knowledge of backup and recovery scenarios. 
(6) Good skills in all Oracle\SQL tools. 
(7) A good knowledge of Oracle\SQL security management. 
(8) A good knowledge of how Oracle\SQL acquires and manages resources. 
(9) Sound knowledge of the applications at your site. 
(10) Experience and knowledge in migrating code, database changes, data and menus through the various stages of the development life cycle. 
(11) A good knowledge of the way Oracle\SQL enforces data integrity. 
(12) A sound knowledge of both database and program code performance tuning. 
(13) A DBA should possess a sound understanding of the business. 
(14) A DBA should have sound communication skills with management, development teams, vendors, systems administrators and other related service providers.
title: Database Developer

details:
SUMMARY/Description


An ETL Developer, due to the nature of our teams and engagements, must also be a capable leader. Often working with an architect, they must bring technical leadership and expertise to the project. Specifically, experience with Application Software, Maintenance, Testing, Optimization, Engineering, and Process Improvement projects. They should exhibit a clear and thorough understanding of business processes and workflows and be comfortable working in both waterfall and agile methodologies. Candidates must have advanced knowledge of SQL Server, SSIS Catalog, SSIS, T-SQL, and some data modeling experience. 

 


Key Responsibilities


Design, build, and deploy effective SSIS packages

Implement stored procedures and effectively query a database


Translate requirements from the business and analyst into technical code


Identify and test for bugs and bottlenecks in the ETL solutions


Ensure the best possible performance and quality in the packages


Provide support and address issues in the packages


Work with architects to design optimal ETL pipeline






Qualifications




Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills


Strong grasp of the technical aspects of business intelligence


Strong communication skills, able to regularly deal with both business and technical stakeholders


Proven track record of writing advanced SQL, including query tuning


Experience identifying data quality


Database design experience a plus


Experience designing and building a complete ETL/SSIS process moving and transforming data for ODS, Staging, and Data Warehousing


Knowledge of C#/VB.NET a plus


Ability to utilize ad-hoc techniques to perform on-the-fly data analysis


Proficiency in deploying and debugging a production SSIS environment

ETL Tools
Ab-Initio V2.15, Ab Initio V 3.0.x, Ab initio 3.1.x, Datastage Designer v9.1, Informatica

Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, IBM Netezza, IBM DB2, Teradata v14

SQL, PL/SQL, Unix shell scripting
Scheduling Tools

EME, CA7 Harvest
Domain Knowledge
Banking, Insurance and Logistics
Defect Tracking Tool
HP-Mercury Quality Center
Application Tools
MS Word, MS Excel, WinScp, Notepad ++, EditPlus, TextPad
Data Modeling
Star Schema and Snowflake schema, Erwin tool.

 


Education




BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or similar


Masters in related field preferred
title: Database Developer

details:
Database administration experts-are you ready to grow your career by applying your database expertise to more complex projects with some of the nation's top companies? Let Vaco serve as your advocate in presenting you to clients who are looking for Database Administrators. Our recruiting staff gives you an advantage over your competition by promoting your strengths and assets directly to hiring managers while helping you to be more prepared for your interviews.From keeping you up to date on market trends and industry expectations to providing you with valuable insight into the company culture, compensation expectations, and growth opportunities of specific clients, Vaco will give you the edge you need in today's highly competitive job marketplace. If you are passionate about database administration and are ready for a rewarding new challenge, let Vaco help you to make it happen. Apply today!As a Database Administrator, you will be responsible for developing and managing system databases as well as for database oversight within technical architecture and organizational initiatives.Your daily duties and responsibilities in this role will generally include:
Designing database schemas, building tables, writing store procedures and working with the application development team
Understanding, implementing, documenting and maintaining database roles and security
Utilizing expertise in data management and data processing techniques
Developing SQL queries and ad-hoc reports as needed
Providing expertise on SQL clustering and replication
Utilizing SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), SQL Server Reporting Services(SSRS) and SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS)
MUST HAVE EXPERIENCE: SQL, MySQL, AlwaysOn 


As a Database Administrator, you must be highly technical, analytical and critical thinker. You need to be capable of working proficiently at both strategic and tactical aspects of a project. It is also important that you have excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally and effectively with all levels of staff.Specific qualifications for the role include: • Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in Information Systems or in a related field working with advanced level systems and software integration concepts or equivalent work experience• Minimum 3 years of experience in a DBA role• 3-5 years' experience of Microsoft SQL Server and other similar technologies• Minimum 3 years' experience with relational database modeling• Experience with SQL clustering and replication• Familiarity with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), SQL Server Reporting Services(SSRS) and SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS)• MUST HAVE EXPERIENCE: SQL, MySQL, and AlwaysOn

Database Developer

details:
Job Type: Direct-Hire
In this job, here are some of the duties to be performed:  ITAC is helping an amazing client in the Birmingham area find a Database Administrator.  This position administers database technology and systems responsible for backup, recovery, server architecture, performance tuning, security, auditing, metadata management, optimization, statistics, capacity planning, connectivity and other data solutions of mission-critical database systems.  The administrator will perform the capacity planning required to create and maintain corporate databases and processing demands.  Providing database solutions, the administrator will solve complex business issues including data processing, loading, performance improvements, data storage, and data replication.  The right candidate will be an Oracle subject matter expert with the ability to evaluate releases of Oracle, its tools, and third-party products to ensure that the organization is running efficiently.
Education: Bachelor's Degree
(Preferred)
To be considered for this job, candidates may be required to have the following skills and experience: 
Extensive experience as a Database Administrator with Oracle or other enterprise database technologies.
Skilled in handling all phases of database development and management.
Demonstrated proficiency working with relational databases, data structures and/or database management systems.
Extensive experience supporting critical systems and providing technical solutions.
Experience with Oracle.
Proficient in SQL.

Oracle certification highly preferred.

title: Database Developer

details:
The role of the Data Management Specialist is to manage data and data quality in enterprise applications, while safeguarding against data loss both on premise and within the Cloud. The Data Management Specialist will also guide decision makers in determining where to place specific data while considering business purposes.

 

The Data Management Specialist is also responsible for the strategic design and implementation of BI software and systems. This includes selecting, blueprinting, gathering requirements, designing, and rolling out BI solutions to end users. The Data Management Specialist will ensure high levels of BI availability through support functions and in-depth testing.

 

This individual will participate in organizational governance activities; have a solid understanding of the data needs of the business; and act as the key implementer and enforcer of data policies, processes, procedures and standards set out by the technology and business leadership.

 

This individual is also expected to lead in preventing data quality issues by identifying frequent user errors, and working with business units to strengthen user competence. 




·       Comprehensive data analysis and report design experience

·       Experience with MS SQL Server, MS Access and other relational database systems.

·       Expertise in Business Intelligence tools.

·       Demonstrated ability with ETL design and development.

·       Strong ability to analyze user requirements and build front-end applications according to specifications.

·         Strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles and practices. 

·       Full project management and development life cycle experience.

·       Good knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws.

title: Database Developer

details:
The team is composed of what is traditionally known as a physical DBA, as opposed to a Logical DBA.
This particular role will be performing these duties both on the IIAS (Netezza) DB2 LUW database as well as on any of our 1000 SQL Server installations.
Expectation that this resource to take on an on-call rotation one week out of every 5.
Strong communication skills are required as there will be quite a bit of back and forth communication with developers and internal customers.




Understanding of relationship between availability requirements for critical applications and the database objects they require.
Ability to provide expert review of database and SQL related application changes in order to minimize impact to the availability of production database systems.
Ability to perform database changes with minimal impact to the availability of production database systems.
Strict adherence to data access policies and procedures.
Ability to effectively utilize existing database performance and monitoring tools used by client.
Ability to accurately interpret technical manuals and references that outline the proper application of database administration tools and advanced techniques.
Ability to communicate accurately and effectively with peers, Systems Programming, Systems Development, technical management, customer areas, and solution vendors.
Ability to instruct non-SR database administrator associates on advanced techniques of database administration.
Ability to provide customers with expert direction on the most efficient methods of data access and manipulation.
History of taking ownership of problems and providing expert resolution.
Ability to independently handle complex database administration tasks and problems.
Ability to research and resolve database issues through the use of available tools and resources (as an individual and as part of a group effort).
Continuing education through technical training.
Excellent customer service.
Ability to identify, and act on, opportunities to "add value" to database administration.
Ability to provide appropriate status reporting on projects and tasks.
Ability to quickly and accurately identify/correct problems with database systems.
title: Database Developer

details: •       Designs logical and physical databases and coordinates database development (relational and others) as part of the project team developing applications that use a database management system. Codes, tests and implements physical database objects. Creates and administers jobs, scripts, data imports/exports, replication and any other necessary database related components. Performs application support by implementing database changes and assisting developers with problem resolution, technical and performance issues. Installs and supports databases for third party software installations.  •       Participates in and/or performs database and database management systems (DBMS) related tasks for the installation of environmental software and provides information and/or specifications related to database hardware infrastructure or equipment. Works with automation teams to coordinate the setup, installation and testing of DBMS software and tool upgrades, patches or service packs.  •       Establishes backup/recovery and disaster/contingency procedures. Develops, codes and tests jobs, scripts and other objects or components needed to perform backup and recovery tasks. Collaborates with key areas to coordinate and participate in Business Resumption Testing. Supports problem resolution and lessons learned regarding recovery or restart of database subsystems/servers. Performs database restore and recovery tasks.  •       Monitors database performance using available tools and performs database administration tasks. Works with software developers and other stakeholder to identify and resolve issues related to database access performance, database hardware, network issues, and environmental software or configuration issues. Leads in the resolution of database problems that affect the availability of production data. Provides on-site and on-call support. Works efficiently in order to minimize impact to the stakeholders.  •       Ensures security of data, includes managing user access through database security groups using least necessary access principles. Creates and enforces standards regarding data access.  •       Leads in the effort to install, evaluate and recommend database related software that will increase productivity and improve efficiency. Determines methodology to be used for evaluation and coordinates and compiles results of the evaluation. Works with vendors, as applicable, to resolve problems and answer questions during the evaluation.  •       Provides guidance to all stakeholders with database related decisions, questions, problem resolution and Ad hoc database updates. Frequently provides access reports for audit purposes.   •       Participates in Information Management work groups both locally and within the FRS dealing with data management, data governance, and database technologies.  •       Ensures the adherence to policies, standards, and reference architectures, as applicable, as well as compliance to all standard procedures and controls including all proper documentation,  •       Conducts and completes access reviews and follows all change and incident management procedures.   •       Possesses strong data analytics and Business Intelligence skills, and demonstrates a thorough understanding of data management concepts (including ETL) and best practices.  •       Creates requirements and design documentation for analytics projects and works with project managers to ensure that all required project artifacts are created, updated, and archived.  •       Strong knowledge of structured query languages as well as SSRS, SSIS, and PowerShell. Sound knowledge of data visualization tools including Tableau.    •       Knowledge of statistical modeling techniques and tools such as Python and R preferred.

details:

· Work with MDBA team and SQL Core team to scale up internal expertise in VROPS/Blue Medora
· Grow Monitoring MVP in support of SQL Server monitoring, including HA and Windows event log monitoring

· Support development of user stories in Rally and artifacts/automation scripts in GitHub
· Provide KT to SQL DBA operations team on use of VROPS for Day 2 support


Qualifications

· Self-driven with the ability to work in a self-guided manner

· Strong attention to detail and problem solving skills

· Excellent communication, presentation (both oral and written) skills

· Adaptability to a changing environment

· Skill in office productivity & collaboration tools

o VROPS, Blue Medora SQL MP, Log Insights

o vCENTER/VRO/VRA, GitHub, Rally, Prometheus

details: Oracle DBA  6 month contract Downtown ATL  Responsible for the full range of database development, support activities and detailed analysis. Reviews and revises database designs and ensures that all technical and business requirements are met. Builds database structures based on detailed design. details: Job Description At this time, the client does not allow any candidates to work C2C. ALL contractors MUST be W2 employees of Bartech if selected for this position  If you are an experienced SQL Server DBA looking for a position with a leading company, Bartech can help! We are a leading staffing firm and our clients include some over the nation’s biggest companies. Our client has a need for a SQL Server DBA. This is a contract position; however it is not uncommon for assignments to transition into permanent positions with our client companies. If you have the background we are looking for, and you are interested in an opportunity to get your foot in the door with leading company, we want to talk with you!                        SQL Server DBA         Job Responsibilities Your specific duties as a SQL Server DBA will include:  The SQL Server / PostGreSQL DBA will be responsible for the implementation, configuration, maintenance, and performance of critical SQL Server/PostGreSQL systems, to ensure the availability and consistent performance of our corporate applications. This is a hands-on position requiring solid technical skills, as well as excellent interpersonal and communication skills. The successful candidate will be responsible for the development and sustainment of the SQL Server/ PostGreSQL, ensuring its operational readiness (security, health and performance), executing data loads, and performing data modeling in support of multiple development teams. The database supports an enterprise application suite of program management tools. Must be capable of working independently and collaboratively. Manage SQL Server / PostGreSQL databases through multiple product lifecycle environments, from development to mission-critical production systems. Installation, configuration and upgrading of PostGreSQL /Microsoft SQL Server/MySQL/Oracle server software and related products. Establish and maintain sound backup and recovery policies and procedures. Take care of the Database design and implementation. Implement and maintain database security (create and maintain users and roles, assign privileges). Database tuning and performance monitoring. Application tuning and performance monitoring. Setup and maintain documentation and standards. Plan growth and changes (capacity planning). Work as part of a team and provide 247 supports when required. Do general technical trouble shooting and give consultation to development teams. Interface with PostGreSQL/MSSQL/MySQL/Oracle for technical support. Configure and maintain database servers and processes, including monitoring of system health and performance, to ensure high levels of performance, availability, and security. Apply data modeling techniques to ensure development and implementation support efforts meet integration and performance expectations Independently analyze, solve, and correct issues in real time, providing problem resolution end-to-end. Refine and automate regular processes, track issues, and document changes Assist developers with complex query tuning and schema refinement. Provide 24x7 support for critical production systems. Provide standard operation support; validating backup / restore, performance monitoring, system availability and evaluating logs Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities after hours. Share domain and technical expertise, providing technical mentorship and cross-training to other peers and team members.     SQL Server DBA Job Requirements As a SQL Server DBA you must represent our company well by being responsible, punctual and motivated to go above and beyond the call of duty. You must also be highly detail-oriented and organized with excellent analytic and problem-solving abilities. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills.  7+ years MS SQL and PostGreSQL Server Administration experience required Experience with AWS and Aurora PostGreSQL system services and tools. Experience with AWS and preferable certification in Solutions Architect and/or System Operations Administration Experience with Performance Tuning and Optimization (PTO), using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools Experience with backups, restores and recovery models Knowledge of High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery (DR) options for PostGreSQL/MS SQL Server Experience working with Windows server, including Active Directory Excellent written and verbal communication Flexible, team player, get-it-done personality Ability to organize and plan work independently Ability to work in a rapidly changing environment Ability to multi-task and context-switch effectively between different activities and teams    SQL Server DBA  As a SQL Server DBA with Bartech, you will be working through an established and respected staffing organization with 40 years of serving as a trusted partner to our client companies. We are dedicated to providing our talent with personal, responsive attention, and will assign an employee care representative to answer any questions or concerns that you might have. Depending upon the client, the assignment and your performance, you can find potential opportunities for direct employment. Your hard work and professional dedication will be rewarded with competitive compensation, including benefits. Available benefits for SQL Server DBA Position may include (but are not limited to):  Exceptional medical, dental, and vision 401(k) Paid time off, including holidays                                                     Make the most of your experience! Apply now!  Applicant must be eligible to work in the US for immediate opening. Keywords:

details: Job Title:  Oracle DBA - Financial Services Industry - Charlotte, NC Job Description:  Ranked as a top Fortune100 Financial Services company, our client has an opening for an Oracle DBA to work onsite in Charlotte, NC.  Imagine everything that you could learn to advance your career while working at a Fortune 100 company with around $2.0 trillion in assets.  This position seeks talented candidates who will put the customer at the center of everything they do.  Inquire about this opportunity and you could end up on a diverse and inclusive team where you’ll not only be valued but feel inspired to give your all to get the job done.  The person filling this position must be able to:   * Develop operational policies, procedures, controls and standards  * Develop, implement and maintain automation efficiencies using scripting languages (PERL, KornShell) in a UNIX environment  * Develop and maintain implementation guides and maintenance processes and documentation  * Database software certifications, roadmap planning and maintenance management  * Perform database environment capacity planning and availability management   * Collaborate with partners to resolve company database policy compliance and vulnerability violations  * Provide 24x7 on-call support for complex production problems to include experience with escalation and communication of the problem to senior management  * Consult with and advise senior management on high impact database solutions and database management topics  * Consults extensively with multiple groups, to lead initiatives that could have enterprise impact  * Provide oversight, mentoring, and leadership to less experienced staff  * Leads the planning, analysis, design, implementation, maintenance, and control of the organization's server-class databases.  * Consults with and advises senior management and multiple clients on high impact data or database management issues, influencing strategic direction.  * Handles and leads various large-scale or highly complex data/database management activities including one or more of the following:   Designing highly complex logical and/or physical databases in Oracle;  Leading highly complex data modeling, mapping, integration, and capacity planning efforts;  Developing management policies, procedures and standards; and gathers business requirements identification, analysis and development.  General Comments * 7+ year’s database design and administration experience  * A BS/BA degree or higher in information technology  * 7+ years of experience with Linux, Solaris and other flavors of UNIX.  * 7+ years of experience with Oracle technologies (Oracle RAC, ASM, partitioning, security, performance tuning, memory management, SQL tuning, statistics gathering, Application audit logs, Scheduling, etc.  * 7+ years of experience in utilizing performance tuning tools like Explain plan, AWR, Grid control or similar technologies. Understand and interpret the reports generated from tools and resolve performance issues. * 7+ years of experience in backup and recovery, application patching, cloning, maintenance and problem solving within the Oracle 10g, 11g and 12c environment.  * 5+ years of experience in leading and supporting upgrade activities within the Oracle 10g or greater environment. * 5+ years of experience with Med (1TB) to Large (30 TB) sized databases * Proven ability to troubleshoot and trace data related issues throughout the architecture  * Must be strong in analyzing how Oracle resources are being used during SQL executions.  * Ability to write and maintain high quality documentation  * Proven ability to build and maintain strong working relationships with business partners  * 3+ years of experience with CA Unicenter Autosys  * 2+ years of experience with Golden Gate data or Shareplex replication  * 2+ years of experience with Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) Additional Details:   Job ID: 322541 Dept ID: 10600 Location: Charlotte, NC United States of America Industry: Online / Full App Job Type: Temp Position Folder Group ID 258  Posted Date:4/18/2018 Domain:arna Contact: [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]

details:
The Bureau of Intelligence and Research, Office of Consular and Management Liaison (INR/CML) requires a Database Administrator Subject Matter Expert (SME) to support ongoing operations of the CML Information Management System (CIMS); assist with new functionality definition, development, and implementation; and provide maintenance and administration of a SQL Database system which is deployed on a .NET Framework. CIMS supports INR/CML administrative operations and is hosted on JWICS.  The SME shall possess extensive knowledge of SQL/Server. The SME will have experience with database storage structures, database objects, ad hoc report generation, T-SQL queries, and database tuning. The SME will have experience protecting and securing sensitive data.  The SME will be responsible for the day-to-day operations of the SQL/Server database.  Responsibilities include: 
Creating and managing database user accounts.
Providing front-end support to end-users of the system and resolving issues as they occur.
Monitoring the state of the system and taking preventive or corrective actions as required and working with the technical team when necessary.
Providing insight to management and other technical team members about the state of the system.
Diagnosing and reporting critical errors to management and other technical team members.
Creating, customizing and delivering bi-weekly, monthly and quarterly customer reports.
Creating customized ad hoc reports to support customers, management, and partners.
Interfacing with the customer, performing feasibility analyses and documenting all new database and application requirements, and system changes or fixes to existing database components.
Assisting developers with the definition, scoping, implementation, and testing of new functionalities to meet evolving requirements.
Assisting end-users processing or using partner components or other government agencies' data exchanges and interfaces as necessary.
Demonstrating new database and application functions and training end-users on the use of new functions as they are added to the database.
Assisting end-users with document output format conversions.
Providing first level, in-person technical support by analyzing and troubleshooting various software and hardware issues.
Providing guidance to analysts on effective ways to leverage technology and perform specific tasks more efficiently.
Facilitating meetings with the analysts and management to identify, discuss and gather information about new functional and business requirements.
Assist the customer in identifying and resolving various and unusual issues directly related to their daily tasks and work flow processes.
Assist the customer and management team in discussions with partner components and other government agencies regarding the use, access, and protection of the data, reports, and database.
Identify the impacts of partner component and other government agency requests for change with respect to interfaces, data, or reports. Assist in providing the scope of those impacts and providing possible alternative approaches to address or mitigate the impacts. Assist in providing work estimates for any requested implementations.

BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience
Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (SQL Server 2012)
Extensive experience with user interface development
Extensive experience with maintaining and updating SQL Server databases
Extensive experience with SQL Server 2012, to include SSRS and SSIS
Expert experience with tuning and optimizing T-SQL queries and database
Expert experience with DISA STIG's guidelines.
Must be able to multi-task and work with multiple end-users simultaneously
Some experience with Microsoft Business Intelligence
Extensive experience with the customer's specific business area, problem set, and legacy systems
Top Secret//SCI security clearance

POSITION TITLE: SQL Server DBADEPARTMENT: Information Systems________________________________________________________________________GENERAL PURPOSE: The SQL Server Database Administrator (DBA) is responsible for effective provisioning, installation/configuration, security, operation, and maintenance of SQL server database management system.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Database monitoring, administration, upgrades, backup, and disaster recovery planning & testing;
General responsibilities include maintenance of multiple environments (development, testing, and production), including patching, troubleshooting, object maintenance (e.g. partition, table, index, users/roles) creation/maintenance, space management, SSIS & SSRS deployments, and security management.
Add and maintain users on the SQL Servers Databases; assigning application (SQL) access, ensuring security, and maintaining their configurations are within standards;
Work closely with remote DBA services vendor to support day to day management of database environments and ensure database stability and performance.

Work with cross functional IS teams to accommodate the database design and administrative needs, such as working on effective solutions for database implementations and deployment of database changes to the higher environments.
Develop an expert knowledge of applications being used to provide high levels of support to users;
Participate in the development of long range planning for new projects and facilities; serve in an advisory capacity on database procedures and methods.
Design, document, and implement effective utilization of resources for optimal performance and enforce database standards and database use guidelines.
Ensure that external and internal regulations and policies governing data management are met including regulations concerning security, audit ability and privacy.
Perform other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: An undergraduate degree with a technical major such as Information Technology, MIS, or Computer Science from an accredited institution of higher learning; minimum 5 years of experience working as a SQLServer database administrator; or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.NECESSARY KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Ability to: work from designated office for collaborative/interactive fulfillment of duties; concentrate in an open-office “cubicle” environment; appropriately and directly interact with other staff members and/or outside associates; perform telephone and/or computer work for extended periods of time; operate office equipment such as computer, telephone, and copy/scan/fax machine; attend and participate in meetings via phone, computer, or in person.
Experience managing SQL Servers 2016/2014/2012/2008R2, SQL Clustering, and SQL Backups.
Must have extensive experience with TSQL, with good understanding of OLAP and OLTP databases of SQL 2008 and above.
Strong Experience with database recovery solutions, such as backups and restores with good understanding of transactional process of SQL Server databases.
Strong SQL Server database maintenance and performance tuning skills.
Expertise in database replication, mirroring and other high availability methodologies.
Experience with SQL server version upgrade and migration.
Knowledge and experience of database management in cloud environment i.e. Azure, AWS etc.
Knowledge of database performance monitoring tools i.e. Solarwinds DPA.
Knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle, Agile/SCRUM methodologies.
Results-driven with the ability to take initiatives, handle multiple tasks and shifting priorities and meet deadlines.
Experience creating data models, ERDs, writing and maintaining technical documentation.
Excellent oral and written communication skills including good grammar, voice and diction.
Responsibilities sometimes require working evenings and weekends, sometimes with little advance notice.
LICENSING AND CERTIFICATION: MCSA/MCSE in SQL 20016/2014/2012.WHAT WE OFFER:Benefits include:
Paid Vacation time
Paid Holidays
401k employer match
Full line of Healthcare Benefits
Opportunities for career advancement

details:
Job Description - Senior SQL DBA
Senior SQL DBA

We have a client with their headquarters in the Bahamas. They are currently looking for a talented, driven Senior SQL DBA to join their IT team. This SQL DBA must have the ability to work independently in a fast paced and demanding environment. The Senior SQL DBA will be given the opportunity to think outside the box so our client is looking for someone passionate about learning and constantly looking for a better solution. The ideal SQL DBA will have experience working in a investment firm and/or furtures trading company. Again, this is a challenging and rewarding opportunity for someone passionate about data technology, extremely meticulous and detail orientated, with a drive for producing high-quality work in a hands-on role. Your primary goal shall be to improve the robustness and performance of the company's data infrastructure.

Key Responsibilities and Competencies

Take full ownership over database systems after a structured transition period involving existing DBA staff.
Provide expert guidance and SQL knowledge to developers when they are
designing data models and data access layers.
Exert control over direct access to database by developers, and be able to plan and implement a transition away from known anti-patterns.
Support Integration Testing in the Software Development Life Cycle.
Monitor, analyze daily operations, suggest and implement improvements.
Designing database architecture.
Planning and performing required backups and migrations.
Act as a mentor within the Data team
Actively take part in building a robust DataOps process.
Use industry-standard tools and techniques to monitor our data environment.
Build and maintain documentation on our data environment.
Work with existing DBA staff to manage and provide after-hours support for critical core business processes that interface with the database.

Skills, Experience & Qualifications

Post-secondary education in a technical discipline preferred.
7+ years in a database administrator role with MS SQL Server.
Experience with Hadoop and/or temporal databases would be an asset.
Domain knowledge of finance or trading would be a plus.
Good interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and within a team.
Excellent communication skills that facilitate teamwork and interaction with colleagues including strong stakeholder engagement.
Good organizational skills.
A strong drive for results and continual improvement.

details: Onsite in Vance, AL  4 year contract.  Mandatory Tasks - Controls and manages database configuration including installing and upgrading software servers and application tools, ensuring that version control procedures are observed, applying fixes, and maintaining supplier and user documentation. Job Description:  We are looking for a senior DBA with more than 7-10 years experience including Teradata V12 or higher.   Support multiple Teradata systems including independent marts, development/UAT, disaster recovery, and the enterprise warehouse.  Manage/Monitor system performance, including workload management and throttling in TASM, query performance and tuning, physical node behavior, and amp distribution.  Consult on physical database implementations, PPI, skew analysis, join methods, and data access paths.  Work with Teradata GSC in resolving RDBMS related incidents.  Implement and administer access policies in conjunction with corporate standards.  Support Mainframe administrative functions including archive and job scheduling.  Manage, design, support, and consult on practices of storage management, archive, restore, and disaster recovery. Working knowledge of Mainframe interfaces and execution: TDP, JCL, TSO, ISPF, FICON, NDM. Working knowledge of Viewpoint and Teradata Data Mover. Ability to work with minimal supervision, with general guidance from other Senior DBAs and managers.

IBM Stage Developer
W126 N7449 Flint Drive, Menomonee Falls, WI
6 month contract
 
This candidate will be onboard to support a DataHub Migration Project. The management group is seeking a candidate with IBM Data experience with designing and architecture. An ideal candidate will have experience migrating from older version to newer version of DataStage.
 

 
JOB SUMMARY:
Works closely with customers, business analysts and team members to understand business requirements that drive the analysis and design of quality technical solutions. These solutions must be aligned with business and IT strategies and comply with the organization’s architectural standards. Involved in the full systems life cycle and is responsible for designing, coding, testing, implementing, maintaining and supporting applications software that is delivered on time and within budget. Makes recommendations towards the development of new code or reuse of existing code. Responsibilities may also include participation in component and data architecture design, performance monitoring, product evaluation and buy vs. build recommendations.
 
GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Provides application software development services or technical support typically in a defined project.
• Develops program logic for new applications or analyzes and modifies logic in existing applications.
• Codes, tests, debugs, documents, implements and maintains software applications.
• Maintains, tests and integrates application components.
• Ensures that system improvements are successfully implemented.
• Demonstrates an understanding of FIS systems and the financial services industry.
• Analyzes requirements, and translates business requirements into product designs.
• Writes technical specifications and other forms of documentation.
• Suggests technical alternatives and improves/streamlines processes and systems.
• Completes project assignments and special projects commensurate with job expectations.

• May provide leadership and/or guidance to other technical professionals.

Qualifications:
Banking/Finance background preferred
- IBM DataStage 8.1 - 5 to 8 years
- IBM DataStage 11.X programming - 2 to 4 years
- Korn shell scripting - 5 to 8 years
- Oracle sql programming - 3 to 5 years
- Experience working on Solaris & Linux OS Operating System
- Experience/knowledge of Enterprise Scheduling tools like BMC Control-M, CA Autosy.

EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience.
 
GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:
• Knowledge of end-to-end systems development life cycles (i.e., waterfall, iterative and other modern approaches to software development) 
• Proficiency in business modeling and requirements definition disciplines through Unified Modeling Language (UML), use cases, etc.
• Excellent customer service skills that build high levels of customer satisfaction for internal and external customers 
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills to technical and non-technical audiences of various levels in the organization (e.g., executive, management, individual contributors) 
• Willingly shares relevant technical and/or industry knowledge and expertise to other resources 
• Excellent problem-solving, team, and time management skills 
• Is resourceful and proactive in gathering information and sharing ideas

title: Database Developer

details:
SUMMARY:

The Database Administrator is responsible for the creation, implementation, management, troubleshooting and maintenance of MS SQL databases, or other relational databases in support of large data collection and analysis efforts.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Identify and understand the requirements with respect to the databases that need to be developed
Create, implement, manage, troubleshoot and maintain databases to track and analyze large amounts of complex information
Define standards, controls procedures and documentation for database organization, and configuration management
Map out conceptual designs for planned databases
Write database documentation to include requirements, data standards, scripts procedures and definitions for the data dictionary
Design test and implement database triggers, scripts and packages
Develop scripts for data export into various formats to include MS Word.
Identify, troubleshoot and resolve database issues in collaboration with other IT staff and users
Write SQL querie

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE and QUALIFICATIONS

Must be a US Citizen
Current Secret Security Clearance Preferred
5+ years of experience with relational databases such as Microsoft SQL
