details: Data Specialist   What You'll Need To Succeed  * 2-4+ years of experience in HR data systems and processes is needed.  * Full working knowledge of Workday and One View are essential.  * Intermediate to Advanced Excel knowledge, including vlookups and pivot tables.  * Have a passion for providing White Glove Service and effectively run operations with a process improvement mindset.  * Strong organisation skills will be important as well as attention to detail and diligence.  * Will need to multitask and see work through to full implementation.  * Work with multiple stakeholders and interfaces will be part of the role ; strong relationship building and communication skills are key.  The Data Specialist delivers best in class service to key stakeholders & to the overall business to improve HR Operations using HR systems and tools. The role leverages internal tools such as One View for HR standard Global reporting and Workday as the HR System. This role also owns Workday data management and is the subject matter expert in all Workday processes.   Data Specialists collaborate with Line Managers, outsourced partners, Employee Services HR contacts, People Experience Leads and HRBPs to deliver overall operational effectiveness while concurrently supporting data integrity and providing data based insights. If the idea of being an HR powerhouse providing outstanding support and key insights across the business excites you, then read on!   Who You Are & What You'll Do  You are someone who loves the world of data! Flawless data management and keen analytics with a process improvement mindset will help you deliver smooth HR Operations and administration. As a system super user, you will work closely with HRBPs and Line Managers to ensure organizational data integrity. You will play a critical role supporting the business through restructures and key HR moments such as Data Validation for Annual Pay Review. When employee issues are escalated, your expertise will play a critical role in troubleshooting data and system issues within HR processes and/or HR administration in collaboration with Service Delivery HR.   You're a born leader: You'll have an opportunity to be in a key role supporting HRBPs to enable a huge step change in HR Operational delivery.  You're a strategy guru: You'll learn to proactively track and chase where necessary to ensure accuracy and compliance to drive increasing efficiency in HR operations.  You're a dot connector: You'll really put your analytical skills to use with knowledge of HR Operations and data systems to unlock key insights to improve HR and business effectiveness.    Monroe Staffing Services is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

details:
Database AdministratorYou are a database administrator with strong foundations supporting SQL Server in a 24/7 production environment. You are looking for an opportunity to delve deeper into and expand your knowledge of heterogeneous database environments. Webroot is seeking to provide a database administrator with the opportunity to use their current skills and cultivate their desire to grow their expertise. For the motivated database administrator, this is a chance to be part of a Global Database Support team that builds, supports, and maintains infrastructure components in high transactional production and non-production SQL Server, MySQL, and Oracle database environments, along with other applications such as SharePoint Tableau and QlikView. This team is talented, tenured and driven, which means that our database administrator will feel invested in having strong mentorship opportunities, formal training and other chances to develop their skills. If you have the desire to grow your technical expertise in database administration, apply today!In this role you'll support all production and non-production databases with multiple concurrent users, ensuring control, integrity and accessibility of data. This will include ongoing maintenance and troubleshooting of development and production database environments. Our goal is to stabilize the environment and maintain systems with 99.99% uptime. This will involve: Supports all production and non-production databases with multiple concurrent users, ensuring control, integrity and accessibility of data. Responsible for the ongoing maintenance and troubleshooting of development and production database environments. Implement/maintain backup and recovery of database systems, assist in database performance monitoring and tuning of queries. Automate and monitor processing of database systems, ETLs, SSIS and data replication. Work on Quarterly goals to stabilize the environment and maintain systems with 99.99% uptime. Develop and automation of system management tasks. Responsible for standards and design of physical data storage, maintenance, access and security administration. Coordinate with and support QA/IT/Development and other stake-holders as appropriate to ensure successful completion of development/infrastructure projects. Perform installation, configuration, migration, upgrade and administration of Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2/2012/2016 or later, Oracle 11g/12c, Oracle EBS R12 and MySQL servers. Top-notch communication and problem-solving skills to build and maintain strong, trusting relationships with non-technical users, as well as with technical peers in software development roles. Provide 24/7 On-Call support on a rotational basis.
You will bring to the table: Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems or related field experience. 4+ years experience with SQL Server administration in Production environment. 3+ years production environment experience with at least one of the following – MySQL, Oracle and Oracle EBS administration. Experience with Database performance tuning, SQL tuning, reporting and data analysis. Strong ability to troubleshoot and resolve DB system issues. Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment. Strong Windows and Linux operating system skills. Ability to write customized scripts using T-SQL stored procedures/scripting languages to monitor server components. Ability to multi-task, prioritize and engage productively on multiple projects simultaneously. Experience with High Availability solutions – AlwaysOn, LogShipping, Transactional/Merge Replication, Mirroring and Failover Clustering technologies. Knowledge of EMC VNX, VMWare technologies and Amazon/Akamai Cloud platform Experience in the following technologies/products a plus: Solarwinds SSIS/SSRS Sharepoint/QlikView Ability to learn new technologies quickly and efficiently. Excellent verbal and written skills are required. Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced work environment
At Webroot, we do more than secure our customers' personal computers, mobile devices and networks. We also nurture our employees' most critical assets – their talents, experience, and career aspirations. Webroot has the energy of a start-up with the strength and stability of an Internet security market leader. We foster the innovative culture you'd expect of a company that's making a statement. Webroot is a company in which you can invest yourself fully, knowing that you're not only protecting our customers around the world, but also that your talents and innovation will be recognized and rewarded. We encourage you to learn more about us and explore our job openings. Secure your future. Ensure the same for your career. Principals only - no third parties, please. Webroot Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

The successful candidate will become an integral part of our global IoT engineering team and contribute to building a high quality, distributed software systems for our SaaS platform serving a wide user base. Responsibilities: The Database Administrator role will primarily be working with Oracle 11g and 12c databases to ensure the integrity of enterprise data in a Highly Available environment. Participation in 24x7 on-call rotation. Required Experience:  Bachelor of Science in an IT related field or equivalent business or technical experience Minimum of 5 years of experience as an Oracle Database Administrator and/or Oracle Database Engineer managing business critical applications Database optimization, performance tuning, backup and restore, space management, troubleshooting Oracle errors and resolving database-related issues Oracle products, specifically:  Oracle Real Application Clusters, Data Guard, Automatic Storage Management, OEM, Partitioning, Tuning and Diagnostics options Experience applying Critical Patch Updates and keeping up to date on latest advisories, security alerts and bulletins Linux, including Unix/Linux shell scripting Defining and creating database tables, schemas, indexes and debugging stored procedures and packages Knowledge of code migration, ability to manage database changes throughout varies stages of development life-cycle Ability to open, work, and manage tickets with vendors including Oracle Support Services Excellent verbal and written communication skills

ETL DEVELOPER 
Seeking an experienced ETL Developer for a global organization.  The ETL Developer will help design data integration between in house and external 3rd party systems. The main function of the ETL Developer will be to develop, create, and modify general computer applications software or specialized utility programs utilizing software packages considered and you will be responsible for designing software or customizing software for client use with the aim of optimizing operational efficiency.  Previous experience working in an Agile environment is desired.

details:
magine One is seeking a Microsoft SQL Database Administrator - Lead (NMMES) for a large Navy support contract.  
 
Position Summary
Minimum of 8 years of experience working as an MS SQL database administrator in a production environment.  Excellent performance tuning skills for tuning critical databases and jobs.  Proactively prevent database issues by closely monitoring the databases on a regular basis and implementing the tools and procedures required to maintain a very stable environment.  Responsible for administering, analyzing, recommending, and supporting data structures and data processes required to meet business objectives.
 
Duties and Responsibilities



Manage and support the deployment of builds into different test as well as production environments.

Manage / Configure of batch jobs

Manage purge jobs

Manage database statistics

Tune and resolve database performance problems

Monitor Production database performance and lock contention

Develop scripts for re-organization of database objects, index rebuilds, partition maintenance

Effectively manage and monitor all aspects of MS SQL/Oracle environments (development, test, and production)

Monitor database space usage and work with system DBAs to obtain the necessary space allocated in the databases

Assist in creation of SQL/PLSQL scripts any required database stored procedures, functions and automated jobs

Manage / support data migration activities

Prepare a daily report indicating the database health for support of daily database operations

Assist with the planning and execution of database software upgrades and patching



Skills and Qualifications



Computer Science or Business degree or equivalent working experience

10 years’ experience in the Information Technology field with a minimum of 8 years’ experience specifically supporting MS SQL/Oracle Databases.

Knowledgeable of Datapump utility

Oracle PL/SQL experience is a plus

Oracle OEM GRID experience is a plus

Excellent communication skills and works well with diverse teams or independently



Educational Requirements: 



Must meet Information Assurance Technical (IAT) Level II certification criteria specified in DoD 8570-01M

A computing environment certification such as Microsoft SQL Administered




Security Requirements: U.S. Citizenship required. Candidate must have a secret or the ability to obtain a secret DOD clearance.





Imagine One offers a full package of benefits and competitive salary, excellent group medical, vision and dental programs. 401K savings plan; $4K annual tuition reimbursement ($5K if pursuing Master’s degree); employee training, development and education programs; profit sharing; advancement opportunities; and much more! Imagine One is an Employee Owned Company!

title: Database Developer

details:
The ideal candidate will assume the role of Database Administrator and be integral to the planning, direction and execution of our organization’s database architecture to support and enhance the data needs of our business.  Candidate should be able to perform maintenance tasks on the current environment while also looking toward enhancements for scalability and the overall growth of the business. This is a “hands-on” position requiring solid T-SQL Developer skills. SSRS/SSIS experience is a big plus. 
 
Essential Roles and Responsibilities
§  Manage SQL Server databases through development, testing, and mission-critical production environments.
§  Configure, monitor, and maintain servers and server processes for optimal system health and performance.
§  Document and apply data modelling techniques to ensure consistency in development and implementation efforts, while meeting DB performance expectations.
§  Analyze, track, refine, and resolve issues in real-time, providing end-to-end troubleshooting.
§  Provide technical mentorship and cross-training to other team members, while assisting in query writing, stored procedures, triggers and user defined functions.
§  Design and develop best-practices for queries and stored procedures with best practices for use by other team members.
§  Some off-hours/flex support will be expected in this role for system maintenance and monitoring activities.

Required Qualifications
§  BS Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field.
§  3+ years MS SQL Server administration experience within an enterprise environment with emphasis on 2 and 3 tier architectures, server versions 2008 R2 thru 2016.
§  3+ years Windows Server experience, including utilization of Active Directory and Windows best practices and concepts.
§  Advanced knowledge and experience in T-SQL coding: query writing, stored procedures, triggers and user defined functions.
§  Experience with performance tuning and optimization, native monitoring and troubleshooting tools, and backup/restoration/recovery models.
§  Experience with SSIS packages and SSRS reporting tool.
§  Thorough understanding of security, high availability, disaster recovery, replication/mirroring, failover clustering, and log shipping best practices.
§  Ability to contribute to project planning, scope, and versioning dialogues and documentation.
§  Strong verbal and written communication skills.
 
Preferred Experience
§  Previous experience within the healthcare industry.
§  Experience working within a highly integrated team comprised of both technical and non-technical members.
§  Experience working independently on projects and tasks with minimal instruction.
§  Solid understanding of industry standard fundamentals including data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis.
§  Deep rooted desire to contribute to constantly adapting techniques, technologies, and concepts.

details:
The Oracle Applications DBA (E-Business Suite (EBS) Applications) understands the technical aspects of Oracle Databases and E-Business Suite in great depth, specifically 11gR2/12c databases and EBS R12.2.x.  The individual provides project and day to day operational support for Oracle 11gR2/12c databases running Oracle Applications on R12.2.x.  This role will monitor and tune databases to optimize stability and performance in standalone or clustered EBS environments. Individual will be a key team member of the ERP team and will be responsible for all aspects Oracle E-business Suite database planning, design, back-up and recovery specifically 11gR2/12c and EBS R12.2.x.

Roles and Responsibilities:

Serves as primary technical expert for Oracle database and Oracle 11i E-business suite management owning accountability for optimization including EBS security, performance tuning, troubleshooting, including leading and coordinating efforts with IT teams as needed for internal and external systems. 
Responsible for identifying root cause for the application and database issues reported while providing production and operational support including pro-active database and application monitoring. Debug and evaluate risks and coordinate issue resolution by successfully deploying into Oracle EBS 12.2.x application and database systems.
Develop and implement the technical procedures, standards and security for Oracle EBS Application databases.
Coordinate with team members to ensure releases are deployed correctly and that all change management processes are followed as per the defined SOP’s.
Patch, install, upgrade and maintain Oracle E-Business Suite R12.2 or higher applications, databases including the e-commerce platform.
Perform Oracle EBS applications and database administration functions (i.e. patching, monitoring and troubleshooting etc.)
Provides DBA support for the Business Intelligence team and applications including Hyperion and OBIEE.
Responsible for evaluating patching requests, communicating constraints, risks, issues and timelines for deployment. 
Collaborates with development team peers to initiate and execute Oracle database and application updates. 
Streamlines cloning or similar activities to build/refresh non-production environments. 
Supports and enforces change management by adhering to SOP’s, including maintenance across multiple environments, code promotion and deploying approved patches. 
Supports IT security Audit Reporting and provide input and recommendations as required. 
Serve sas the primary lead Oracle Application DBA, tasked with successfully recovering systems from Disaster for Deployed systems. 
Perform other duties as assigned. 


 
Basic Qualifications 

A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related discipline, or the equivalent knowledge and experience.
Minimum 5 years of experience in providing advanced Application DBA support of Oracle E-Business Suite Release 12.2.x is mandatory
Experience with Oracle Enterprise Manager (OEM) 11g/12c is a must
At least 5 years of experience in database design, administration, or maintenance. 
3+ Experience hands-on experience in managing Oracle database 11g and 12c on Redhat Linux platform
Expertise in all major versions of technology stack including Database, iAS, Forms, Reports, PL/SQL, Java, Enterprise Manager, SOA, WebLogic and JVM. 
Hands-on operational expertise as an Oracle DBA, with technology including RAC, SSO, DataGuard, High Availability and Backup/Recovery. 
Experience with Oracle RMAN backup and recovery with NetBackup
At least 5 years of hands on working knowledge with SQL, PL/SQL, Unix Shell commands and scripting are required.

 
Preferred Qualifications 

Master’s degree is preferred. Must have ability to support customizations, sharing implementation and best practices advice during patching and upgrade cycles.
Solve complex issues using methodical troubleshooting based on expert knowledge of Oracle EBS applications functionality and technology
Requires ability to work on assigned tasks independently with limited direction
Develop and update documentation of all support DBA processes and procedures
Takes accountability for assigned tasks and deliverables and escalates appropriately and in a timely manner as needed
Takes personal responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work, and achieves results with little oversight.
Results driven with demonstrated successful outcomes.
Ability to handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent written and verbal communications skills.
Able to work flexible hours when needed.
Strong knowledge of ERP R12 patches inter-dependencies on Oracle modules including AOL, Supply Chain, Financials, etc.
Extensive knowledge of Oracle Applications utilities like adpatch, adclone, adrelink, adadmin, adcrtrl, FNDLOAD, etc
Experience with Workflow, Workflow Mailer, and the Java Notification Mailer
Experience with RAC, Standby database, Dataguard and E-Business failover/recovery and managing DR environments.

 
Supervisory Responsibilities 
None

USP offers an impressive benefits package, including:

Generous paid time off – 13 paid holidays, 10 sick days and 15 vacation days per year to start
An annual 401(k) contribution, beginning after 1 year of service, of 10% of pay (base and bonus) every pay period that vests immediately
Comprehensive individual and family healthcare plans with affordable premiums and low annual deductibles ($250/individual or $500/family)


The U.S. Pharmacopeial Convention (USP) is a scientific nonprofit organization that sets standards for the identity, strength, quality, and purity of medicines, food ingredients, and dietary supplements manufactured, distributed and consumed worldwide. USP’s drug standards are enforceable in the United States by the Food and Drug Administration, and these standards are used in more than 140 countries.

Being a part of USP means belonging to a diverse culture made up of more than 1,000 talented professionals working together at five international locations. We share our expertise in science, IT, human resources, quality assurance, communications, administrative management, and more...all to support an overall mission dedicated to making a difference by providing standards and programs that help improve the quality of medicines, dietary supplements, and foods worldwide.

USP is proud to be an equal employment opportunity employer (EEOE) and affirmative action employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to sex, race, age, disability, religion, national origin, color, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other protected class. We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities.

USP does not accept unsolicited resumes from 3rd party recruitment agencies and is not responsible for fees from recruiters or other agencies except under specific written agreement with USP.

details:

Responsible for monitoring and adjusting the database management systems and applications; identifies, analyzes and resolves performance issues to meet end user requirements. The role will focus on optimizing the performance of the database as well as database security, backup, and recovery of database management systems. Install, configure and upgrade the server software and related products. Participate in “care and feeding” of the database design and implementation. The Database Administrator II will also provide general technical troubleshooting and give consultation to development teams. UK HealthCare is a comprehensive healthcare system consisting of the medical, nursing, health sciences, public health, dental and pharmacy patient care activities of the University of Kentucky in Lexington, KY, and in several off-site locations.

UK HealthCare is a comprehensive healthcare system consisting of the medical, nursing, health sciences, public health, dental and pharmacy patient care activities of the University of Kentucky in Lexington, KY, and in several off-site locations. UK HealthCare is expanding through the construction of a new hospital and potential future acquisitions.



Qualified candidates must have demonstrated experience in building and administering databases and have strong SQL design skills. The ideal candidate should have experience with common database operations including security, partitioning, maintenance, backup and recovery, indexing, and database tuning. Candidate must have knowledge of data architecture, management, analysis, modeling, and flow. The ideal candidate has experience with the IBM suite of data warehousing technologies including Pure Data for Analytics/Netezza. Also, the ideal candidate has experience developing analytical databases with a variety of programming languages as well as being well organized with strong attention to details. Finally, the ideal candidate has experience or exposure to the healthcare industry including regulatory requirements like HIPAA.

To apply for the job RE14027 submit a UK Online Application at www.uky.edu/ukjobs.

If you have any questions, contact HR/Employment, phone (859) 257-9555 press 2. Application deadline is May 20th, 2018.

The University of Kentucky is an equal opportunity employer.

The Lead is viewed as an expert in the administration and support of database technology. The candidate is expected to communicate common goals and direction for the team and also provide superior technical leadership.DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:- Responsible for database design, development and administration of large scale Operational, OLTP andanalytical data structures including logical and physical design- Provide SQL performance tuning on both OLTP and Data warehouse environments- Optimize DB2 resource utilization by tuning queries, recommending indexes, and configuring database parameters-Provide data migration support-Provide trend analysis to management team to enable them to make informed decisions regarding resource management-Lead, mentor and/or provide guidance to less experienced database analysts where applicable including guidance for troubleshooting escalated issues-Partner with offshore DBA resources and thoroughly document processes to ensure successful implementation by offshore staff and Production Control-Provide on call rotational 24/7 Incident Response to database alerts from production monitoring tools and Command Center personnel-Analyze Key Performance Metrics and make recommendations for improvements-Provide input on the selection and implementation of all database administration tools-Maintain the integrity of data within the production environment including the execution of proper backup and restoration policies and procedures which provide point-in-time restore capabilities (disaster recovery)-Enhance site monitoring to improve availability and performance-Perform database capacity planning and trend analysis -Deploy database changes in strict accordance with change management policies and procedures-Interact and coordinate work with System Administrators, Project Managers and fellow team members to support various project requestsSUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:-None

MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:-Bachelor's degree in CS/MIS or equivalent experience-Minimum of 6 years of heavy DB2z database administration experience and production support-Requiring DB2z V11 experience-Not required but prefer DB2 V11 or V10 database certification-Experience working with very large database partitioning-Experience working with large systems in data sharing sysplex environment-Preferred experience in data modeling with Star Schema and *Operational Data Store* concepts-Experience with evaluating and consolidating database workloads to maximize hardware resources-Experience working with IBM Admin tool suite, Query Monitor, and Omegamon (DB2 PE)-In-depth knowledge of DB2 utilities such as LOAD, UNLOAD, RUNSTAT, REORG, COPY, COPYTOCOPY, MERGECOPY, MODIFY and SPUFI.-Working knowledge of IDAA-Solid understanding of DB2 client tools such as DB2 Connect and Visual Explain-Hands on experience with performance tuning of complex SQLs-Experience with DB2 Stored Procedures (SQL and COBOL)-Prefer experience with IBM Optim Move for DB2-Prefer experience with Erwin or RDA data modeling tools-Prefer that the candidate has worked in an onshore/offshore model-Candidate must have excellent communication skillsFifth Third Bank is proud to have an engaged and inclusive culture and to promote and ensure equal employment opportunity in all employment decisions regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, military status, veteran status or any other legally protected status.

details:
DBA Lead - DBA Shift Lead, DBA Platform Lead, DBA Platform Sub-LeadSeeking an Database Administrator. The candidate will have 10 years of experience demonstrating comprehensive knowledge of key tasks on a large high visibility IT programThis role will lead the Database team in the Administration, development, test, or of the Database platforms supporting functions across one or more teams or clients, including designing, implementing and maintaining new databases, backup/recovery and configuration management. Install database management systems (DBMS) and provide input for modification of procedures and documentation used for problem resolution and day-to-day maintenance.This role will lead efforts to accelerate development of automation scripts for deployment, configuration, security hardening and patch management of standard database and Web Service platforms using Accenture pre-developed automation assets. Optionally integrate with database virtualization tools such as Delphix to automate the migration of data across virtual infrastructure and reduce the time to deliver services for cross-environment data synchronization for testingUtilize vendor scripting tools and processes, including but not limited to software distribution, backups, performance measurement, tuning, and license and asset management to allow automated as well as remote systems management of the server environment to reduce time to deliver services Key Duties include:
Working with other teams to consolidate database instances and storage using capacity and performance analysis tools to identify underutilized instances, duplicate copies of data and identify associated server, network and storage resources that can be "right sized" in preparation for transition to new CoLo datacenter or hybrid cloud.
Evaluate utilization of Exadata systems workloads to determine the strategy for use and migration moving forward. Some consolidation of Exadatas is expected as the existing workload moves to more cloud-friendly, lighter weight database platforms readily available in all major cloud service provider environments.
Explore licensing/hosting opportunities for Exadata within Oracle's Cloud (assuming FedRamped) to leverage cost incentives for the high-density mission critical databases.
Lead the database engineering team in integrating, implementing, and operating OIT Database systems (Datacom/DB, IBM DB2, Microsoft SQL Server, and Oracle) across the entire enterprise and with cloud service providers to support 24x7x365 availability.
Provide leadership in problem determination/analysis and isolate system problems utilizing diagnostic and system management tools (i.e. system dumps and system/component traces, monitoring tools, vendor problem data bases).
Maintain security hardened baseline configurations and deploy security (patches), software maintenance (patches) and new software releases and supporting products infrastructure as directed by the system owner, policy, or the Cybersecurity Directorate.
Lead the Engineering, integration, implementation, and operation of a virtualization strategy to include Database server consolidation, storage consolidation, and automation. Automation includes seamless Database provisioning, and non-disruptive workflow/application/data migrations.
Maintain up-to-date documentation of all procedures, infrastructure diagrams, system configuration and baseline standards, implementation plans, system back out plans, system recovery plans, maintenance plans, system upgrades, and all system changes.
Provide leadership in process, management and resolution of all event, warning, alert, as well as alarm messages. Contractor shall design and implement automated responses to system issues (e.g., automatic failover, resource allocation adjustments).
PREFERED REQUIREMENTS
Design and builds relational databases. Performs data access analysis design, and archive/recovery design and implementation.
Development of strategies for data acquisitions, archive recovery, and implementation of a database.
Development of data warehousing blueprints, evaluating hardware and software platforms, and integrating systems.
Reviewing and development of object and data models and the metadata repository to structure the data for better management and quicker access
Microsoft SQL Server
Licensing/hosting of Exadata within Oracle's Cloud
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS3 to 10 years of experience and a B.S. degree. Bachelor of Science (BS) can be substituted with an additional 4 years of related experience
3 years experience with Datacom/DB
2 years experience with IBM DB2
3 years experience with Oracle systems
3 years experience with Oracle Data Guard for multi-site failover and smarter use of standby databases for reporting and analysis functions, rather than sitting idle awaiting failover operations.
4 years experience Exadata systems

LISK in partnership with Remedy Technical and Professional Recruiting is looking to recruit a IT Support Technician for our Information Technology group to be located at our main facility in Clifton Springs NY.  GW Lisk is a leading global supplier of custom solenoids, solenoid valves, LVDT’s, and flame arrestors for commercial, automotive, aerospace, oil and gas and military organizations. Other tasks as assigned by management

Bachelor's degree in information technology/computer science or engineering and/or a combination of education and recent, relevant experience.

Exceptional written and verbal communication skills

Microsoft MCDBA and/or Oracle Certifications a plus

details:
NWN is recognized as one of the top 16 Cisco partners in the U.S. and a leader in the IT services industry with many awards and elite certifications from Hewlett Packard, NetApp, EMC, Microsoft and VMware to name only a few. With over 600 employees in 12 locations across the U.S. the company is on a fast track to even greater success. If you're a top performer looking for a new opportunity we want to talk to you!NWN has an opening for a SQL Database Administrator (DBA) who will be responsible for designing, implementing and maintaining production databases, SQL queries, procedures, scripts and objects, including tables, primary and foreign key relationships, triggers, constraints, etc. In this role, you will perform advanced performance analysis and tuning within SQL Server; as well as, the other tiers of the infrastructure to identify and resolve bottlenecks and problems, and you'll ensure that databases are working properly in conjunction with applications. You must have the ability to complete data mining efforts and ad hoc analysis to ensure a firm understanding of source system data and how it relates to business requirements. And you will work closely with the development team to optimize SQL queries, support coding best practices and implement optimal coding techniques. SQL DBA Responsibilities:  Maintain uptime of all database applications from a database perspective Develop, test and deploy SQL changes Manage the day-to-day operations of database systems and ensure that the systems and applications function effectively Make sure that the database systems provide sufficient computing power to deliver the desired level of business performance Test new software or software versions such as database server upgrades Initiate and complete recovery action after system failures when required Provide advice to developers and users on database standards, data structures and terminology Prepare technical reports on the operation of systems Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities when needed Create ad-hoc reports
 Required Qualifications: 5+ years MSSQL experience Experience with Performance Tuning and Optimization (PTO), using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools Exceptionally skilled in troubleshooting query performance Excellent written and verbal communication Flexible, team player, "get-it-done personality Ability to organize and plan work independently Ability to work in a rapidly changing environment Ability to multi-task and context-switch effectively between different activities and teams Ability to analyze data to find inconsistencies MCTS, MCITP, and/or MVP certifications a plus
 Data warehouse experience a plus
title: Database Developer

details: Responsible for the day-to-day maintenance and monitoring of Oracle and SQL server databases. Interact with development staff in all areas of database design and operation.  RESPONSIBILITIES/TASKS:  * Refresh non-production databases. * Perform routine, day-to-day database administrator duties and observe more senior database administrators in order to build skills in data modeling, SQL and PL/SQL tuning, application tuning, creation of database objects, data modeling, utilities, UNIX commands and UNIX programs. * Participate on committee that sets SQL and PL/SQL programming standards. * Consults with users to identify current database requirements and clarify objectives. * Review documented processes and procedures. * Develop understanding of and stay current with advances in information technology by reading manuals, trade periodicals, and technical reports relating to Oracle and SQL Server databases. * Provide technical assistance to other Information Services personnel. * Maintain confidentiality of information processed. * Participate in on-call rotation for production database support.  ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES/TASKS FOR SENIOR DATABASE ADMINISTRATOR:  * Make technical recommendations and implement policies and standards relating to the architectural design of databases, network communications, data access and security requirements, and backup and recovery procedures for production and development databases. * Create and refresh non-production databases. * Monitor and manage database growth and size requirements. * Plan, develop, test, and tune databases. * Assist and mentor development staff in data modeling, SQL and PL/SQL tuning, application tuning, creation of database objects, utilities, UNIX commands and UNIX programs. * Install third-party applications for testing and implementation in production. * Lead committee the set SQL and PL/SQL programming standards. * Develop and maintain SQL and UNIX programs to monitor database conditions and activities. * Identify application and/or SQL performance problems and assist in their resolution. * Analyze, review, and alter database parameters and structure to increase operating efficiency or adapt to new requirements. * Consults with users to identify current database requirements and clarify objectives. * Document current, revised, and new processes and procedures. * Perform prototyping and database tuning and optimizing. * Stay up to date with advances in information technology by reading manuals, trade periodicals, and technical reports relating to Oracle and SQL Server databases. * Provide technical assistance to other Information Services personnel. * Work with minimum supervision and exercise sufficient discretion and independent judgment. * Mentors peers and IT personnel. * Manage relationship with Oracle and Windows Support. * Analyze and plan for future database, server, storage, and network requirements. * Gather database statistics for trend analysis. * Research and plan implementation of new database features and enhancements. * Design database growth management strategies. * Design database backup and recovery strategy including usage of standby databases for Business Resumption Plan. * Produce periodic reports for management and staff. * Work with no supervision and exercise discretion and independent judgment. This position description identifies the responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the performance of the position. Other relevant essential functions may be required.EDUCATION: Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or related field required. Certification or progress toward certification of, industry-recognized professional designation in Oracle and SQL preferred and encouraged. Combinations of relevant education and experience may be considered in lieu of a degree. Continuous learning, as defined by the Company's learning philosophy, is required. Oracle Certified Associate, Oracle Certified Professional and/or Microsoft Certified Solutions Assistant: Sql Server preferred.  EXPERIENCE: Database Administrator Three to five years experience within an IT environment which provides the necessary skills, knowledge and abilities. One year relevant experience with Oracle and/or SQL Server databases preferred. Experience within the insurance industry highly preferred.  Senior Database Administrator Five years experience within an IT environment which provides the necessary skills, knowledge and abilities. Three years relevant experience with Oracle and/or SQL Server databases or maintaining a production environment preferred. Experience within the insurance industry highly preferred.  SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/ABILITIES (SKA) REQUIRED:  * Ability to troubleshoot client/server problems. * Ability and proficiency in the use of computers and company standard software specific to position. * General understanding of database administration. * Basic knowledge of Oracle and/or SQL Server database management tools. * Basic knowledge of SQL and PL/SQL, UNIX commands. * Excellent oral and written communication skills. * Ability to apply the principles of logical thinking to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. * Ability to comprehend the consequences of various problem situations and to make sound decisions or to refer problems to appropriate people for decision making. * Ability to manage multiple projects and meet necessary deadlines. * Ability to work varying hours, including evenings, weekends and holidays as required. * Ability to perform other assignments at locations outside the office.  ADDITIONAL SKAs REQUIRED FOR SENIOR DATABASE ADMINISTRATOR:  * Ability to work closely with Database engineers to implement standards, policies and procedures developed. * Ability to document and develop standard operating procedures for day to day activities. * Ability to make technical recommendations. Demonstrated high level of competency in Oracle and/or SQL Server database administration. * Thorough knowledge of and ability to use Oracle and/or SQL Server database utilities and management tools. * Thorough knowledge of SQL and PL/SQL, UNIX commands, and shell programming. * Ability to establish work flows, manage multiple projects, and meet necessary deadlines. * Advanced knowledge of communication layer between client, network and Oracle/SQL Server databases. * Advanced knowledge of and demonstrated competency in all facets of Oracle and/or SQL Server database administration. WORKING CONDITIONS: Work is performed mainly in an office environment with minimal hazards. May be exposed to temperatures, which may be cooler than a normal office setting. Travel may be required. The qualifications listed above are intended to represent the minimum education, experience, skills, knowledge and ability levels associated with performing the duties and responsibilities contained in this job description. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity is valued and we will not tolerate discrimination or harassment in any form. Candidates for the position stated above are hired on an "at will" basis. Nothing herein is intended to create a contract.  Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

details:
HomeAdvisor and our sister company, Angie’s List, have combined to create the largest home services marketplace in the nation. Part of ANGI Homeservices (ANGI), we connect millions of homeowners across the globe with home service professionals through our innovative and user-friendly products. ANGI Homeservices operates 10 brands in eight countries, and is headquartered in Golden, CO. The Team and Role        We’re looking for someone who is a data-driven self-starter and a great communicator, with the skills necessary to ensure the successful growth and support of our data warehousing systems. As a data warehouse developer, you’ll be making valuable contributions to the continuous transformation and improvement of our information systems.  This role works with the rest of the Enterprise Intelligence team within HomeAdvisor to support the entire information development lifecycle, including data profiling, ETL and data model design and development, testing, and support.  Responsibilities
Support the ongoing development and maintenance of our data warehousing systems, including a migration to elastic Cloud Data Warehouse
Work with project teams and business contacts to understand their needs and requirements and ensures the design and delivered solution meets those needs.
Work closely with the enterprise data warehouse team to translate business requirements and logical data models into working data artifacts.
Understand the source data available and map sources to the target design using a variety of tools: Informatica, Python scripts, PLSQL
Conduct thorough testing of ETL code changes to ensure quality of data produced
Makes changes to data artifacts to reflect changes required by new subject areas
Monitoring the EDW platform metrics, while recommending and implementing improvements
Assisting the team with performance tuning for ETL and database processes
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in a technical field -or- equivalent experience
3+ years of experience in IT software development (such as systems analysis, data warehousing, ETL, etc)
3+ years’ experience with ETL tools, such as Informatica, Talend, SAP Data Services, SSIS, etc.
2+ years’ experience with Database development, administration, debugging, and tuning
Experience with relational database design/modeling using tools such as ERstudio or ERwin
Expert-level SQL coding/querying skills
Great interpersonal and communications skills
Must be comfortable working in a fast-paced, flexible environment, and take the initiative to learn new tools and concepts quickly
Bonus Skills
Solid understanding of systems architecture
Experience dealing with large relational data sets, including load performance, query performance, archiving, etc.
Experience with Business Intelligence tools such as Crystal, Business Objects, Microsoft SSRS, or Oracle OBIEE.
Project experience with unstructured or semi-structured data
Snowflake cloud data warehouse experience is a bonus

details:
Our team is what makes Octo great. At Octo you'll work beside some of the smartest and most accomplished staff you'll find in your career.  Octo offers fantastic benefits and an amazing workplace culture where you will feel valued while you perform mission-critical work for our government.  Voted one of the region’s best places to work multiple times, Octo is an employer of choice!

Octo Consulting Group is seeking a Database Administrator to join our growing team in Washington, DC on an exciting and vibrant Federal Government role.  This is literally the infrastructure on a worldwide outreach program and the work you do will matter in how the US is viewed around the world.

Our DBA will Manage, monitor and maintain MySQL and Oracle databases and related components on on-premise hosted infrastructure as well as on AWS RDS.  Your main focus will be on 24/7 uptime and support of COTS products using these databases.

Responsibilities Include:


Maintaining Oracle RDBMS (Oracle 12C) and MySQL in an enterprise environment

Analyzing complex problems that impact the project and provide innovative solutions/options for improving performance

Analyzing database requirements within an object-relational database system, such as ORACLE RDBMS, of assigned projects. 

Analyze and determine information needs and elements, database relationships and attributes, proposed manipulation, data flow and storage requirements, and data output and reporting capabilities.

Develop new database design and modifications; applying knowledge of database management systems to coordinate maintenance and changes to databases;

Testing and implementing changes or new database designs; writing logical and physical database descriptions, including location, space, access method, and security requirements.

Provide direction to programmers and analysts as required to affect changes to database management systems. Provide answers to database questions. 

Monitor databases and analyze/organize data and apply new technology designs and programs

Monitor and tune all databases for optimal performance

Work closely with all WordPress team members to debug performance-related problems and identify performance bottlenecks

Proactively make recommendations and follow through to keep Databases secure, up to date, and functional for intended user groups




Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 8 years of experience with database design, installation, and support.

Familiarity with Jira, Jenkins, GitHub.

Experience working on most phases of applications programming activities, independent of supervisory guidance.

Experience with database development and administration requirements.

Understanding and wide application of technical principles, theories and concepts in Database Development, Administration and Performance related disciplines.

Experience with Web Services, and SOA

Experience with projects delivering website and application solutions for US Government clients strongly desired.

At least 8 years of post-collegiate professional experience

Primary or secondary degree in Computer Science/Information Systems or related field

Working knowledge of AWS


Desired Skills


Familiarity with Agile management concepts.

At least 1 years of experience in Content Management System (WordPress)

At least 1 years of experience with AWS.


Physical Requirements:


Regularly required to sit for extended periods up to 80% of the time; frequently required to move about to access file cabinets and use office equipment such as PC, copier, fax, telephone, cell phone, etc.

Occasionally required to reach overhead, bend, and lift objects of up to 10 lbs.

Specific vision abilities required by this job include use of computer monitor screens up to 80% of time


Work Environment:


Individual’s primary workstation is located in an office area

The noise level in this environment is low to moderate


At Octo, our focus is on delivering results that matter. We are a premier provider of digital solutions and services to the federal government specifically in the areas of UI/UX, Agile, Data, and Cloud services.  We support and modernize our federal customer’s mission critical systems and functions. Agility is at our core: it is the mantra that drives us to succeed. We work quickly, analytically and deliver on agency priorities.

Octo is a growth-oriented firm that provides a unique, differentiated employee culture relative to our Federal market peers.  We leverage this growth-oriented and employee-focused culture to attract and retain a higher grade of talent than our peers to be an employer of choice. 

http://www.octoconsulting.com/careers

We are unable to sponsor H1B applicants for this role

US citizenship required as per potential clearance requirements

Relocation will not be offered

details:
Every day, the people of TSYS® and Netspend® improve lives and businesses around the globe through payments. We make it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions including credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services.  We are "People-Centered Payments", and our team has the unique opportunity to help create a world in which payments make people's lives easier and better. This is both a tremendous honor and an important responsibility for those who accept the challenge. If you are looking to make a valuable difference for people everywhere — and for yourself — we may have the right place for you.The Database Administration team is part of the netSpend IT operations and is responsible for administration and management of all databases (oracle, sql server etc).The Oracle DBA role will include, but not limited to design, implementation, and problem analysis and improve operation efficiencies of the oracle database technologies. This individual will share responsibility with the team for overall database support in various database environments.  The individual should be well versed in oracle database administration which includes installation, performance tuning and troubleshooting.Responsibilities:
Responsible for the installation, configuration, troubleshooting, support and maintenance of all database systems including Production, QA, and Development server environments.
Monitoring and optimization of database performance, security, resource utilization, memory configuration, sessions, archive logs, and disk space usage.
Share support for mission-critical database instances, including responsibility for after hours on-call support for issue resolution.
Leverage Oracle expertise and knowledge by providing SQL, PL/SQL, and data expertise to developers and users.
The candidate will be expected to identify opportunities for improving system quality and implementing more efficient processes and management of databases.
Participate in DBA team on-call pager rotation and on-call support duties.
Qualifications:
6+ years of oracle DBA experience on mid to large scale database environments.
2+ years of experience administrating Oracle RAC Environments.
Experience in Oracle Streams or Oracle GoldenGate preferable.
Experience in Oracle 11gR2 preferable.
Proficiency in writing shell s and sql scripts.
Strong knowledge of UNIX/Linux.
Experience in setting up Oracle DataGuard Standby technologies.
Strong knowledge of RDBMS architecture, SQL tuning, PL/SQL troubleshooting.
Good interpersonal skills along with effective communication (both written and verbal) skills.
A good team player, flexible, share knowledge and help others.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or other technology field or equivalent experience.
As provided in NetSpend's Background Check policy, eligible candidates may be subject to drug, criminal history, and credit checks, which will be conducted and used in accordance with applicable local, state, and federal laws

details:
Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, has more technology, greater data resources and far broader expertise than any competitor anywhere. In this role, you’ll be involved in architecting, designing and implementing data warehouse solutions. You’ll be a member of a small team of programmers working directly with healthcare data analysts. We’re automating processes and building a Data Warehouse containing HER and claims data, as well as multiple data products we generate on different cadences.  Primary Responsibilities:
Design, build and test PL/SQL scripts, functions and stored procedures to support ETL (extract-transform-load) processing
Monitor performance of PL/SQL objects and take corrective action to improve results and reconcile discrepancies between the expectations of the business and the structure of the data
Document all database objects, technical procedures, test plans and other elements.
Collaborate with analytics and other teams to determine how current processing methods can be optimized, scaled, and improved
Provide informed feedback for database design and data model decisions
Support monthly data warehouse build process
Code review
Be a good team player and comfortable working in a team environment, delivering timing-critical high-quality deliverables
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, Statistics or any discipline involving data analysis and programming or equivalent experience
5+ years of working experience as a programmer in a relational database environment
5+ years of strong database programming experience (Oracle, SQL Server) with a thirst for complex challenges
2+ years of data warehousing experience skills
UNIX shell scripting 
Strong written and verbal communication 
Preferred Qualifications:
Exposure to Hadoop or other NoSQL databases 
Perl/Python experience
R experience
JIRA
Healthcare/life science experience
Experience with clinical and/or claims data
Understanding healthcare industry terminology and coding (e.g. NDC11, ICD9/ ICD10, HCPCS, CPT, LOINC) 
Optum is a diversified health services and innovation company where data, technology, people and action combine to make great things happen every day. Join us. Learn more about how you can start doing your life's best work.SMCareers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world?s large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.SMDiversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. details:
The Senior Database Administrator I is responsible for supporting multiple critical databases, some with high availability demands.  This role will be responsible for database implementation, performance tuning, ongoing monitoring and maintenance, backup/recovery, security, auditing, production support, migration and verification of the integrity and availability of all hardware, server resources, systems, and key processes.  This position will also independently troubleshoot and resolve problems of diverse scope.  ACCOUNTABILITY: The Senior Database Administrator I is accountable for the day-to-day support and maintenance of Premier’s Oracle and SQL Server database environments supporting applications such as Oracle Clinical, Deltek, Sharepoint and other in house applications.  This role is also accountable for design and architecture of new or enhanced database environments, planning for future business needs and ensuring proper validation and documentation of all database environments.  RESPONSIBILITIES:  Design, implement and manage database environments critical to business processing Configure, monitor and manage database backup, tuning, patching, and disaster recovery architecture and plans Design, support and maintain high availability environments including replication, clustering, and mirroring Support all areas of the enterprise, ensuring all databases run at optimal performance Proactively identify and troubleshoot database performance issues Help establish and enforce database architecture and security standards Ensure that industry-wide best practices and standards are properly implemented Design and maintain automated application migration processes which provide High Availability and SDLC migration for Test, Pre-Production, and Production application servers Independently develop, maintain and troubleshoot complex database procedures Understand written business requirements and translate them into technical design Respond to business requests in a professional manner and with high sense of urgency Coordinate and help lead disaster recovery testing processes Lead database related aspects of any related application upgrades Understand database product licensing models and monitor usage for ongoing compliance Develop and maintain clear and accurate documentation of database architecture and related applications Evaluate, implement and manage ongoing activities to ensure database health and prevent issues Analyze database performance, capacity, and capacity planning for future database expansion to support business requirements Evaluate, make recommendations and manage uptake of database environment patching and new versions, working with stakeholders to plan and execute such updates Proactively identify areas of needed improvement in the database environments and develop and execute against plans for achieving necessary changes Collaborate with business stakeholders to ensure environments are set up to accommodate both current and future requirements Provide support to application programmers through analysis, recommendations and data refreshes as requested for database access and performance problems Maintain documentation of backup and recovery procedures of the physical data storage and logical data design for assigned databases Mentors and coaches junior staff, as applicable Other activities as designated   EDUCATION, SKILLS & COMPETENCIES:   Educational Background    Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field, or equivalent experience    Experience   BS degree and 5-8 years of technology application experience, 4 of which involving database administration; or 7+ years administering Oracle and SQL Server database environments in an enterprise setting Experience in Database Administration of complex systems using Oracle 11/12c and MS SQL Server in a Windows server environment Proficiency developing and maintaining complex scripts using SQL, T-SQL, PL/SQL  and/or Powershell Strong experience with database optimization, performance tuning, backup and restore, table space allocation/management, clustering, managing the overall health and status of the database, managing the database schema, creating triggers and stored procedures, configuring and monitoring logging and resolving database-related issues Experience with evaluation, selection, implementation and management of products supporting DR and HA architecture Excellent technical troubleshooting skills   Experience with Oracle RAC and/or DataGuard preferred Experience with validation of regulated database environments preferred Experience with administration on Unix/Linux platform a plus Familiarity with web services and RESTful Services (JSON and XML) or Java/.NET a plus     Expertise and know-how    Oracle 12.x and MS SQL Server 2012+ administration and tuning Strong SQL or PL/SQL development skills Deep understanding of and experience with database administration on a Windows platform    
Personal skills & behaviours
   Fluent verbal and written English Capable of delivering on multiple competing priorities with little supervision Excellent team player;  collaborative; consensus builder Ability to multitask and work effectively in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities Strong verbal and written communication skills Excellent organizational and time-management skills, able to prioritize work to meet deadlines Strong desire to learn new skills and expand technical experience Accountable, dependable and strong commitment Customer service focused in approach to work both internally and externally  Maintains a positive, results orientated work environment

title: Database Developer

details:
Position:                      Database Administrator II

Department:                Information Technology Services

Reports To:                  IT Manager – Data Management

Location:                      Lenexa, KS

  OVERVIEW:  Grantham University was founded in 1951 by Donald Grantham, a WWII veteran with a desire to make education achievable for fellow military service members and veterans. Throughout the decades, Mr. Grantham’s vision has remained steadfast. Today, the 100 percent online university’s culture of service extends to all adult learners with a desire to improve their lives through higher education. Grantham’s commitment to affordability, accessibility and quality of its more than 50 undergraduate and graduate certificate and degree programs has earned Grantham University a distinguished record as a respected online learning university.

 

Grantham employees – or Life Changers – have access to a comprehensive and flexible benefits package, a celebrated corporate wellness program, paid volunteer opportunities and a shared commitment to making a difference for Grantham University students, each other and the community. Apply today!

 POSITION DESCRIPTION:  Is data is your passion? Do you want to learn new technologies?  We have a job you’d like!  We are looking for an experienced Database Administrator who seeks to expand their passion for data technology and help grow our data team.  Traits we are looking for include a self-learner, detail-oriented, proactive, has initiative, excited about learning new technologies, and is comfortable with self-directed learning.  Query tuning, clustering, and working on newer SQL servers 2016-2017 are part of the functions of this role. This position provides some mentoring to the Database Administrator I.  This role is responsible for installing, configuring, maintaining all MS SQL servers. This is mid-level position requires some oversight, but is expected to perform process analysis and provide recommendations in an autonomous manner. This non-supervisory role works on site in Lenexa, KS.

 

KEY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

·         Install, configure and maintain the operation of a group of MS SQL Servers (2012 – 2016) to ensure performance and availability.

·         Function as team member with other IT employees and numerous functional team leaders from throughout the University.

·         Responsible for the following: database definitions; backups; disaster recovery planning (jointly with the Systems Administrator and/or Infrastructure Management); security planning; account set up and access rights.

·         Design logical and physical database or review description of changes to database design to understand how changes to be made affect physical database (how data is stored in terms of physical characteristics such as location, amount of space, and access method).

·         Establish physical database parameters.

·         Code database descriptions and specific identifiers of database to database management system or directs others in coding database descriptions.

·         Calculate optimum values for database parameters such as amount of computer memory to be used by database and storage I/O configurations.

·         Specify which users can access databases and what data can be accessed by user in each environment.

·         Test, correct errors, and refine changes to the database.

·         Use of utility programs to monitor database performance including query execution plans, query execution times, indexing, and resource usage.

·         Confer with co-workers to determine impact of database changes on other systems and staff cost for making changes to database.

·         Work directly with consultants and technicians from vendor companies.

·         Other Duties as assigned



EDUCATION/ WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS AND DESIRED SKILLS:
·         Relevant (i.e. Computer Science) Bachelor’s degree from an accredited four-year college or university, or relevant job experience is preferred.  
·         Requires a minimum of three years’ experience in installation, configuration and maintenance with SQL Server (2008R2 or newer)
·         Experience in setting up and maintaining MS SQL Server Clusters desired.
·         Experience with PowerShell for automating management tasks desired.
·         Experience with reporting tools such as Microsoft SSRS desired.
·         Experience with ETL tools such as Microsoft SSIS desired.
·         Able to effectively communicate orally (in person and by telephone) and in writing.
·         Able to multi-task, yet maintain close attention to detail and timeliness of work production.
·         Able to work in a positive team-oriented manner with a variety of people (students, faculty, staff, administrators, vendors, and members of the general public).
·         Language Skills: Able to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents. Able to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community. Able to write speeches and articles for publication that conform to prescribed style and format. Able to effectively present information to executive management, faculty and staff.
·         Mathematical Skill: Able to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry. Able to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.
·         Reasoning Ability: Able to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Able to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables 
·         Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
o   Frequently required to use hand to finger, handle, or feel (including the use of computer keyboards) and talk or hear (including the use of a telephone). 
o   Occasionally required to walk, stand.
o   The work station for this role is a cubicle-styled work station. The ability to work in a cubicle-setting and the ability to navigate through surrounding conversations to keep on task is required.
o   Specific vision abilities include: close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus
 The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client in search of a Database Analyst 5 in Charlotte, North Carolina (NC).Summary:Enterprise Database Management is the CoE for database management within the client. This position provides senior level capabilities relative to database administration for the company.The person filling this position must be able to:
 Develop operational policies, procedures, controls and standards 
 Develop, implement and maintain automation efficiencies using scripting languages (PERL, KornShell) in a UNIX environment 
 Develop and maintain implementation guides and maintenance processes and documentation 
 Database software certifications, roadmap planning, and maintenance management 
 Perform database environment capacity planning and availability management 
 Collaborate with partners to resolve company database policy compliance and vulnerability violations 
 Provide 24x7 on-call support for complex production problems to include experience with escalation and communication of the problem to senior management 
 Consult with and advise senior management on high impact database solutions and database management topics 
 Consults extensively with multiple groups, to lead initiatives that could have enterprise impact 
 Provide oversight, mentoring, and leadership to less experienced staff 
 Leads the planning, analysis, design, implementation, maintenance, and control of the organization's server-class databases
 Consults with and advises senior management and multiple clients on high impact data or database management issues, influencing strategic direction

Handles and leads various large-scale or highly complex data/database management activities including one or more of the following:
 Designing highly complex logical and/or physical databases in Oracle
 Leading highly complex data modeling, mapping, integration, and capacity planning efforts
 Developing management policies, procedures and standards



REQUIREMENTS:
 A BS/BA degree or higher in Information Technology 
 7+ years of database design and administration experience 
 7+ years of experience with Linux, Solaris and other flavors of UNIX
 7+ years of experience with Oracle technologies (Oracle RAC, ASM, partitioning, security, performance tuning, memory management, SQL tuning, statistics gathering, Application audit logs, Scheduling, etc. 
 7+ years of experience in utilizing performance tuning tools like Explain plan, AWR, Grid control or similar technologies; Understand and interpret the reports generated from tools and resolve performance issues
 7+ years of experience in backup and recovery, application patching, cloning, maintenance and problem solving within the Oracle 10g, 11g and 12c environment
 5+ years of experience in leading and supporting upgrade activities within the Oracle 10g or greater environment
 5+ years of experience with Med (1TB) to Large (30 TB) sized databases 
 3+ years of experience with CA Unicenter Autosys 
 2+ years of experience with Golden Gate data or SharePlex replication 
 2+ years of experience with Transparent Data Encryption (TDE)
 Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills 
 Must be strong in analyzing how Oracle resources are being used during SQL executions
 Proven ability to troubleshoot and trace data related issues throughout the architecture 
 Demonstrated ability to quickly learn, retain, and apply good interpersonal skills, and perform effectively under time pressure are critical skills required for this position 

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

details:
Apex Systems is Seeking a Sr. Oracle DBA who has done a migration to HANA.  This is a contract to hire and will require candidates to work directly on our W2 without sponsorship.  If interested in applying to the Sr. Oracle DBA role, please send a current resume to Matt Miller at [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]
Scope:
95% of their Oracle database environment utilizes SAP and now they will be migrating from Oracle to SAP Hana.  Need a Sr. Oracle DBA that has about a year of HANA DBA experience.
Tech Stack:
-S/4 Hana is the version they are migrating to (version is not a hard requirement)
-at least 1 year of SAP HANA DBA experience
-5+ years of experience as an Oracle DBA
-Oracle 12c exp.
-Virtualization is in VMware and highly preferred
-Versed in Oracle products such as RAC, DataGuard, ASM, RMAN, Exadata

Soft Skills:
-Can hold their own in a group discussion

-Leads interact with the business so just need to be team oriented

details:
The Data Specialist position will provide ongoing operational and technical support to the Client Relationship Management (CRM) & Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) integrated applications and operations across our client teams. Technical interface and support on Application data sharing with assigned reporting systems and processes. Principle duties will be to implement and maintain a software installation strategy, provide training for Facility Operations Personnel and enhance monthly, quarterly and annual reporting formats. This position supports ongoing data update, query, and reporting functions. Including operational training as required on hardware and software applications associated with CRM/CMMS. Qualified person interacts routinely with field personnel supporting technology applications, as well as providing back office support. Responsibilities 
Supports the System Support Team and corresponding Facilities Operations Team.
Maintain an excellent working knowledge of the designated CMMS / CRM SDA platform with their integration points.
Provide a consistent high level of support to field and back office technical processes to ensure seamless and timely service delivery to client operations.
Manage server and system database operations in maintaining high level of system operation and minimizing operational impact.
Develop and perform audits and validations to ensure data quality
Develop and implement automated operational data report generation to deliver a high level of performance analysis and performance projection.
Support operational analysis of all engineering performance metrics.
Work with software platform developer to ensure maximum utilization of system capabilities in meeting client expectations, and development of improved capabilities.
Provide ongoing CMMS / CRM system user training and documentation to ensure effective utilization by field and back office operations.
Provide, as needed, reporting based on needs of clients.Manage CMMS / CRM hardware and software implementation processes on all added client portfolios.
Other related tasks as may be required of the role. 
Qualifications
Minimum 5 years experience in customer service support in a technical environment
Experience in supporting field hardware implementation and building engineering operations
Strong Excel skills; Proficiency in MS Word and SharePoint Experience with process documentation and presentation
Skills in managing data warehouse and mining of performance data
Outstanding written and oral communication skills
Minimal travel may be required

details:
.Modis has an immediate opening for a SQL Data Analyst job in Beaverton, Oregon. Modis is hiring immediately for a 2 year contract, and the rate of pay is up to $70.00 hour DOE.Work as part of a high functioning team, tasked with supporting day to day operations of a busy Legal Services project, analyzing and maintaining very large transactional datasets in SQL Server. Independently define and develop solutions, with minimal direction, for a wide range of technical and analytical problems. Participate in team meetings and other collaborations, as well as design and peer reviews. Be flexible; prepared to approach things laterally; able to think outside the boxSQL Data Analyst Job description:
Develop, debug and test TSQL code in appropriate environments
Interface with business stakeholders, to identify or clarify requirements in order to address various questions/problems
Develop analytical strategies to analyze and interpret data in support of discovery efforts
Manage and prioritize assigned tasks, ensuring deadlines are achieved, communicating appropriately progression and/or impedances
Job Qualifications and Requirements:
2 years of experience in the payment card industry (PCI) is preferred but not required. Such PCI experience could include: merchant services processor, bank acquirer, bank issuer and/or network (Discover, MasterCard, Visa, etc.).
Experience creating and supporting complex SQL Server objects, batch processes and batch scripts
Experience performing complex data analysis of very large datasets
Experience tuning TSQL queries
Experience using SQL Server error handling
Experience using source control
Experience following change release processes
Ability to understand complex business processes and adapt solutions to meet the needs of the business
Excellent communication skills for interaction with peers, managers and business stakeholders
Must enjoy and have experience working in a fast paced environment
Ability to quickly realign with shifting priorities
Technical Skills:
Advanced knowledge and experience working in Microsoft SQL Server 2012 (or later) and TSQL required
Advanced Database performance tuning skills preferred
Experience working with very large datasets of 10TB or more
Integrated Services (SSIS) or other Extract Transform & Load (ETL) experience a plus
Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS) and Team Foundation Services (TFS) experience a plus
If you're ready to make a change and work on-contract, on-site submit your resume for the SQL Data Analyst job in Beaverton, Oregon today!
